0.title: Didn't make any money from Shark Tank: Ashneer on reports of getting ₹10 lakh per episode
0.article_body: Ashneer Grover, speaking about Shark Tank India, said, "None of us made any money from the show." "Some people said...we made ₹10 lakh per episode, but I'd have been happy with even ₹5 lakh...They asked us to commit to spending ₹10 crore each...We said okay," he added. "We weren't paid anything; in fact, we worked like bonded labour," Ashneer stated.

1.title: Filled with joy: Sood on meeting girl whom he helped overcome spinal defect
1.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood recently met Janhvi, a girl whom he helped a few months ago for her surgery as she suffered from a spinal disorder since birth. Janhvi and her father went to Shirdi to meet Sood. While speaking about the same, Sood said, "It fills my heart with joy to watch the young girl stand on her own and...walk."

2.title: MI should have stuck with Tim David a lot more: Shane Watson
2.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson has said he was surprised that MI played Tim David only for two games before dropping him at the start of the IPL season. "They should've stuck with a lot more, even for 4-5 games to see what he can do," added Watson. David played his third game against RR and scored a match-winning 20*(9).

3.title: RPF Bengaluru seizes illicit liquor worth over ₹20,000
3.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) of the Bengaluru division on Wednesday apprehended a person and seized illicit liquor worth approximately ₹20,235. A total of 576 tetra packs of 90 ml whiskey were found in the passenger's bags, the South Western Railway said. The liquor has been handed over to excise department officials, it added, sharing the photo of the seizure.

4.title: Pope uses wheelchair for first time in public due to knee pain
4.article_body: Pope Francis was seen using a wheelchair for the first time in public when he attended the plenary assembly of the International Union of Superiors General at the Vatican on Thursday. He is said to be suffering from knee pain, which has restricted his movement. He has lately been struggling to walk or stand.

5.title: Roads near Sri Lankan parliament blocked for public amid protests
5.article_body: Police have blocked roads near Sri Lankan parliament to the public for the days the House will be in session amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. This comes after 12 anti-government protesters were arrested near the premises for demanding the resignation of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. People residing near parliament will have to show identity proof to commute through these roads.

6.title: BJP discussing Rahul's nightclub visit, not pressing issues: Shiv Sena
6.article_body: Shiv Sena criticised the BJP for ignoring pressing issues but targeting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for his nightclub visit. "Instead of discussing power shortage, lack of jobs, the question of the support price for farmers, inflation, the Chinese army infiltrating the country's borders, members of BJP are still shooting arrows at Rahul Gandhi's visit to Nepal," the Shiv Sena said.

7.title: Unicorn DealShare looks to hire 1,500 people by the end of FY23
7.article_body: Grocery-focused social commerce startup DealShare, valued at $1.7 billion in January, is looking to hire up to 1,500 employees across tech and product side by the end of FY23. As per CEO Vineet Rao, DealShare has already doubled its workforce to 2,000 since last year. It's also planning to acquire 5-10 small brands with their own manufacturing units, Rao said.

8.title: SDMC's anti-encroachment drive near Shaheen Bagh cancelled till Friday
8.article_body: The anti-encroachment drives in the Kalindi Kunj-Jamia Nagar area near Shaheen Bagh and in Sriniwaspuri have been cancelled till Friday, South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) said on Thursday. "The police informed us...adequate force cannot be provided for the drive today. We will reschedule the drive accordingly," SDMC added. Earlier, a drive in Jasola and Sarita Vihar was also cancelled.

9.title: Prayagraj to get Uttar Pradesh's first floating restaurant
9.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led government in Uttar Pradesh is planning to build a floating restaurant in Prayagraj, which will be the first such restaurant in the state. The proposed floating restaurant, which is coming up at the Boat Club, will run on the PPP model and will offer a whole range of cuisines, a government spokesperson said.

10.title: 23-yr-old medical intern sets herself on fire at Noida park, note found
10.article_body: A 23-year-old medical intern from Delhi's Greater Kailash area set herself ablaze at a park in Noida on Wednesday, with police suspecting that she took the step due to a mental health condition. Police found a hand-written note, a two-litre empty bottle of diesel, a purse and a mobile phone on the spot. Police and forensic experts reached the area.

11.title: Hit those who don’t say Bharat Mata ki Jai with sticks: BJP’s Gyan Dev
11.article_body: BJP leader Gyan Dev Ahuja appealed to people to "hit" those who don’t say "Bharat Mata ki Jai" with sticks. "Muslims never ruled India. It was ruled by Mughals and Afghans. Hit those who don’t say Bharat Mata ki Jai with sticks," Ahuja said while speaking at BJP’s Jan Hunkar Rally in Alwar.

12.title: Hindus suffered more due to MNS' stand on loudspeakers: Cong leader
12.article_body: Maharashtra Congress spokesperson Sachin Sawant on Thursday claimed Hindus have suffered more because of MNS chief Raj Thackeray's objection over the use of loudspeakers at mosques. "If we listen to...MNS, along with masjids, 2,400 temples will also not be able to use loudspeakers," he tweeted. MNS' agitation will have repercussions across all religious communities, Sawant added.

13.title: 3 men strip minor boys for gambling, beat them & film act in Hyd
13.article_body: Three men, who allegedly assaulted a group of minor boys after making them strip in Hyderabad's Old City, were arrested after a video of the incident surfaced online. According to the police, the men found the group of boys gambling. To teach them a lesson, the accused hit them with a stick and recorded the act, police added.

14.title: We have ignored Northeast India, it is very disheartening: Ayushmann
14.article_body: Talking about his upcoming film 'Anek' which is based in Northeast India, Ayushmann Khurrana said, "We have...ignored Northeast India...and the kind of racism they face in the mainland...it's very disheartening." "People from the mainland will realise where they are going wrong," added Ayushmann. "It's a very...different film which Indian cinema hasn't witnessed in the past," stated Ayushmann.

15.title: Pant takes all the pressure, responsibility on himself: Chetan Sakariya
15.article_body: Speaking about his tenure with DC, pacer Chetan Sakariya praised coach Ricky Ponting and skipper Rishabh Pant for keeping him motivated. He added, "Pant takes all the pressure, responsibility on himself...[and] whenever the other players do well, he gives them credit." Sakariya has picked one wicket in the two games he has played so far in IPL 2022.

16.title: Russia stole 4,00,000 tonnes of grain: Ukraine
16.article_body: Russia has stolen 4,00,000 tonnes of grain from occupied regions in southern Ukraine, Ukrainian Defence Ministry said. "Russian thieves are bringing death and famine to the world," it added. As per International Grains Council data, Ukraine sold 44.7 million tonnes of grain abroad in 2020-21, making it the world's fourth-largest supplier. The volume of exports has fallen sharply amid war.

17.title: Delhivery shares fall in unlisted market ahead of its IPO: Report
17.article_body: Logistics startup Delhivery's shares fell nearly 40% in the unlisted market from the peak of ₹950/share in January ahead of its upcoming IPO, Moneycontrol reported. The unlisted shares are reportedly quoting at ₹550-600/share on thin trading volume. Delhivery's price band, at ₹462-487/share, is about 19% lower than the current unlisted share price. It aims to raise ₹5,235 crore.

18.title: Boy who ranked 45th in K'taka Police exam paid agent ₹50 lakh: CID
18.article_body: The Karnataka CID team revealed that father of a BSc graduate who secured 45th rank in police sub-inspector recruitment exam had paid ₹50 lakh to an agent to secure higher rank. "The family members of many candidates were actively involved in financing the cheating," a police official said. The recruitment process has now been declared cancelled by the Karnataka government.

19.title: RBI hike to increase SBI's lending rate by 0.02%: SBI Chairman
19.article_body: SBI Chairman Dinesh Kumar Khara has said that the 40 bps hike in repo rate to 4.40% will increase SBI's marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by two basis points. He further said that the removal of excess liquidity from the market will "improve the pricing of loans". As per RBI's announcement, liquidity worth ₹87,000 crore could be withdrawn.

20.title: Apple stops accepting debit & credit cards for app purchases, subscriptions in India
20.article_body: Apple has stopped accepting debit and credit cards to buy apps from the App Store, use Apple subscriptions like iCloud+ and Apple Music in India. Apple's support page states that the company currently only supports net-banking, UPI and Apple ID balance as payment options. This comes after new auto-debit rules from RBI came into force last year.

21.title: I wish to see a Brahmin as the CM of Maharashtra: Union Minister
21.article_body: Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve has said, "I just don't want to see Brahmins as corporators or civic body heads, I wish to see a Brahmin as the CM of [Maharashtra]." He added that so much casteism has come into politics that it cannot be ignored. "There should be a leader who can keep communities together," Patil said.

22.title: 4 terror suspects with Pak link caught with huge cache of explosives in Haryana
22.article_body: Four terror suspects were caught with a huge cache of explosives in Haryana's Karnal city on Thursday. Karnal SP Ganga Ram Punia informed that the accused were in touch with a Pakistan-based man who asked them to drop arms and ammunition in Adilabad, Telangana. The four accused were identified as Gurpreet, Amandeep, Parminder, and Bhupinder, hailing from Ferozepur and Ludhiana.

23.title: Many eco-friendly children’s clothing contain toxic PFAS: Study
23.article_body: Many children's products like clothes, bedding and furniture, including those with green certifications, contain harmful PFAS chemicals, also known as forever chemicals, a study has found. The products labelled as water or stain-resistant are most likely to contain PFAS that aren't listed on label. PFAS are linked with health conditions like cancer, thyroid disease, high cholesterol, asthma, etc.

24.title: Hyd woman's brother arrested for killing her husband over inter-faith marriage
24.article_body: After a 25-year-old man was killed by his wife's family over their inter-faith marriage in Hyderabad, police have arrested her brother in connection with the incident. The couple was returning home on a motorcycle when they were waylaid and attacked with a crowbar. The man died on the spot while the woman was injured.

25.title: WhatsApp starts rolling out emoji reactions for messages
25.article_body: Meta-owned WhatsApp has started rolling out emoji reactions for messages, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced. Zuckerberg said WhatsApp is also adding the folded hands emoji "to help spread thanks and appreciation". "Emoji reactions are coming to WhatsApp so people can quickly share their opinion without flooding chats with new messages," WhatsApp had said in April.

26.title: Which batters have faced the most balls in IPL history?
26.article_body: RCB's Virat Kohli on Wednesday became the first batter to face at least 5,000 deliveries in IPL history. Kohli has faced 5,028 balls in IPL. He is followed by PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan, who has faced 4,863 deliveries in IPL. MI captain Rohit Sharma has faced 4,429 deliveries, while DC opener David Warner has faced 4,062 deliveries.

27.title: I went into a dark place last summer and feared I'd never play cricket again: Archer
27.article_body: Talking about recovering from his injury, England pacer Jofra Archer, who last played a professional match in July 2021, said that he went into a dark place last summer and feared he'd never play cricket again. Archer, who is expecting to make a comeback this month, added, "Suppose...I had rushed my comeback...I might have messed things up more."

28.title: Woman secretly pokes holes in man's condoms in Germany, found guilty of sexual assault
28.article_body: A German court found a woman guilty of sexual assault and handed her a six-month suspended sentence for purposefully damaging her partner's condoms by poking holes in them, German media reported. "We've written legal history," the judge reportedly told the court. "The condoms were rendered unusable without the man's knowledge or...consent. No means no here as well," the judge said.

29.title: Was stuck in make-up van for 3 days with network issues: Anees on Mumbai floods
29.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee said that he was stuck in his make-up van during 2005 Mumbai floods. "I got stuck in bumper-to-bumper traffic. I took U-Turn and came back to shooting spot, and took refuge in make-up van. There were network issues too...I was stuck in the van for three days. We faced difficulty in getting food and water," he added.

30.title: Rohit is disappointed for not being able to convert his starts: Jayawardena
30.article_body: Talking about captain Rohit Sharma's form in IPL 2022, MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said, "He is disappointed that he has not been able to convert his starts but it’s about executing our game plans." So far, Rohit has scored 155 runs in nine games at an average of 17.22. He's yet to cross the 50-run mark in the tournament.

31.title: Delhi man grows plants on roof of his auto to beat heat, pics surface
31.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave conditions across the country, an auto-rickshaw driver in Delhi planted a variety of plants on the roof of his auto-rickshaw to beat the heat. The driver, Mahendra Kumar, said that there are 25 varieties of plants that are planted on the auto-rickshaw's roof. Kumar added, "Auto-rickshaw used to simmer during summers, but now it remains cool."

32.title: Pune ZP to procure essential items needed in 109 primary health centres
32.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) will procure essential items needed in its 109 primary health centres by May-end, an official confirmed. A gap in items worth ₹21 crore was identified of which ₹17 crore was raised through corporate social responsibility and remaining funds will be given by administration. There'll be improvement in services provided at these centres, Pune ZP CEO said.

33.title: 'I just can't bat with you, you run too fast', Maxwell jokingly tells Kohli after run-out
33.article_body: After being run-out for 3(3) while batting with Virat Kohli against CSK, RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell jokingly told Kohli, "I just can't bat with you." He added, "You run too fast. You hit ones and twos. I don't." Maxwell was run-out after Kohli called for a quick single on the last delivery of the ninth over.

34.title: Rainfall predicted in several states/UTs; IMD releases list
34.article_body: IMD has predicted moderate to light rainfall in Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Bihar, Jharkhand, West Bengal, Sikkim, Odisha, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana during next five days. Light rainfall is likely over J&K, Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand during next three days and in Punjab, Haryana and UP today.

35.title: Sketch of man who took off 2 girls' clothes at Delhi school released
35.article_body: A sketch of the man who allegedly entered a municipal school in Delhi and sexually assaulted two girls has been released by the police. According to Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal, the man took off the girls' clothes and urinated in front of an entire class. Police said that continuous efforts are on to arrest the accused.

36.title: Committee should be formed to probe riot incidents: Gehlot
36.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that if Union Home Minister Amit Shah has "courage" then a committee should be formed to probe recent riots across various states. "People showered flowers on Ram Navami processions. Riots happened in seven states and bulldozers were used," Gehlot added. "A similar method like that of Karauli was used in all seven states," Gehlot stated.

37.title: QR code-enabled billboards to be put up in B'luru for anti-tobacco campaign
37.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar has launched a campaign, '#IndiaVsTobacco', to work towards a tobacco-free country. He also unveiled QR code-enabled billboards and posters, which will be put up across Bengaluru for interactive engagement regarding tobacco related health impacts. The billboards reportedly contain a fact about secondhand smoke that people can view by scanning the QR codes.

38.title: 211 arrested after clashes in Jodhpur on Eid: Rajasthan DGP
38.article_body: As many as 211 people have been arrested in connection with clashes that broke out in Jodhpur on Eid, Rajasthan DGP ML Lather said. A curfew, which was imposed in several areas of Jodhpur following the clashes, continued for the third day on Thursday. Four FIRs have been registered by the police and 15 have been registered based on complaints.

39.title: 45 teachers involved in Andhra SSC paper leak: Education Minister
39.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Education Minister Botcha Satyanarayana on Thursday said that 45 teachers were involved in the alleged leak of question papers from the ongoing SSC exams for Class 10 students.  The government has taken action against 69 people, he added. The teachers have been accused of taking photos of the question papers after exams commenced and leaking them online.

40.title: I am not happy with my performance, haven't lived up to expectations: Siraj
40.article_body: RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj said he is "not happy" with his performance in IPL 2022 so far, adding that he has not lived up to the expectations of the fans. "Believe in me, I will make a comeback," stated Siraj. Siraj has picked eight wickets in IPL 2022 so far at an economy rate of 9.47.

41.title: 22 killed, 40 injured as heavy rains trigger floods in Afghanistan
41.article_body: At least 22 people have been killed and around 40 others have been injured after heavy rains in Afghanistan triggered floods, a disaster management official said on Thursday. Hundreds of houses and some 3,000 acres of crops have also been damaged due to the rains. As per the officials, the Taliban government will approach international relief organisations for help.

42.title: I'm excited: Shivangi Joshi on being a part of Khatron Ke Khiladi 12
42.article_body: Actress Shivangi Joshi said that she will be a part of the show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'. She added, "'Khatron Ke Khiladi' is going to be my first ever reality show and I am extremely excited...The show will be a good platform to overcome my fears and test my abilities." "I'm looking forward to meeting Rohit Shetty sir," she said.

43.title: US Prez Biden declares disaster in wildfire-hit New Mexico
43.article_body: US President Joe Biden has approved a disaster declaration for several parts of New Mexico that have been hit by massive wildfires. According to experts, the wildfires are more widespread than usual owing to climate change. Several counties of the state, including Mora, San Miguel, Colfax and Valencia, will receive federal funding for rehabilitation after hundreds of houses were burnt.

44.title: 7 people booked for uploading child pornography in Pimpri Chinchwad
44.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Police on Wednesday registered two separate cases against seven individuals who uploaded child pornography content. According to police, the content had been posted last year on various social media websites. Additionally, police have initiated a probe into the cell phone numbers, email addresses and social media accounts used by the accused to upload the content.

45.title: Have assurance, US won't allow Russia to act against us: Sweden
45.article_body: Sweden has said if Russia directs any activities against it, the US will not allow it. The statement comes after Swedish Foreign Minister Ann Linde met US Secretary of State Antony Blinken. Linde said Sweden will receive support while its potential application for NATO membership is processed. "I feel very sure that now we have an American assurance," she said.

46.title: DMK MPs to contribute one month's salary towards Sri Lanka aid
46.article_body: The Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) on Thursday announced that the party's Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha MP's will be donating their one month's salary towards aid for the crisis-hit Sri Lanka. This comes after Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin appealed to the people to donate to the state government to buy essentials like food and ship them to Sri Lanka.

47.title: Pic shows tunnel used by Pak terrorists in J&K; BSF says Amarnath Yatra attack plan foiled
47.article_body: The BSF on Thursday said that it has detected a freshly dug cross-border tunnel that originated from Pakistan along the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district. "With the detection of this tunnel, BSF-Jammu has foiled the nefarious designs of Pakistan-based terrorists to disrupt the upcoming Amarnath Yatra," BSF DIG said.

48.title: A run-a-ball 40 doesn't suit Pant, won't take DC anywhere: Sehwag
48.article_body: Sharing his opinion on DC captain Rishabh Pant, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said, "He must not carry any baggage and play like the [old Pant]. A run-a-ball 40 doesn't suit Pant and [won't]...take DC anywhere." "When Pant plays with responsibility, the strike rate falls," added Sehwag. Pant has scored 234 runs in nine IPL 2022 matches so far.

49.title: Nobody should speak language of ultimatum: Ajit Pawar to Raj Thackeray
49.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar criticised Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray's "ultimatum to Maharashtra government" remark and said that nobody should speak the "language of ultimatum". "This is not a dictatorship. If you want to give an ultimatum sitting inside your home to your family members, do it, we have nothing to do with it," he added.

50.title: HC grants bail to Pune man booked for raping 17-yr-old niece in 2019
50.article_body: A man from Pune who was booked for raping his minor niece in 2019 has been given bail by the Bombay High Court. The court said the 17-year-old girl was a college-going girl with sufficient understanding. As per a complaint, the man met the girl in college and forcibly took her to a hotel where he sexually assaulted her.

51.title: Didn't feel like a normal scene: Amber on kissing Depp during Rum Diary shoot
51.article_body: Amber Heard recalled her kiss with Johnny Depp while shooting for 'Rum Diary' while testifying during the defamation trial. Amber said the shower scene "didn't feel like a normal scene. It felt real." Recalling an incident in Depp's trailer, she said, "He...picked up...back of my robe with his boot...I...turned around and giggled...He...playfully pushed me down on...bed, sofa...he said, 'Yum'."

52.title: Facebook became Frankenstein monster, devoured user data: WhatsApp's ex-CBO
52.article_body: WhatsApp's former Chief Business Officer (CBO) Neeraj Arora, who regrets WhatsApp's $22 billion sale to Facebook in 2014, tweeted, "Nobody knew in the beginning that Facebook would become a Frankenstein monster that devoured user data and spat out dirty money." He added, "We didn’t either." Arora also said, "Tech companies need to admit when they have done wrong."

53.title: Police stations have become 'centre of chaos' under BJP rule: Akhilesh
53.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the BJP-led UP government and held it responsible for the Lalitpur rape case incident and said that police stations have become the "centre of chaos". "The walls of Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's house are unable to hear the problems of people," he added. Lalitpur SHO is accused of sexually assaulting a 13-year-old rape survivor.

54.title: 2 men die as bulldozer tyre bursts while filling air in Chhattisgarh, video surfaces
54.article_body: Two people were killed when a bulldozer tyre exploded while they were filling air in it at a vehicle workshop in Chhattisgarh. Footage shows a worker filling air in the tyre. Another man then comes and presses the tyre in order to check the air pressure, which leads to the explosion. The incident took place in Raipur's Siltara industrial area.

55.title: WhatsApp's ex-CBO shares Co-founder's old handwritten 'No Ads! No Games!' note
55.article_body: WhatsApp's former CBO Neeraj Arora, who said that he regrets WhatsApp's $22 billion sale to Facebook in 2014, shared a handwritten note by WhatsApp Co-founder Brian Acton, that read, "No Ads! No Games! No Gimmicks!" WhatsApp's other Co-founder Jan Koum used to keep the note taped to his desk. WhatsApp Co-founders quit Facebook a few years after WhatsApp's acquisition.

56.title: Always being told I was fat hurt me, my dad made me feel ugly: Britney Spears
56.article_body: Singer Britney Spears said that one of the things that hurt her the most in her childhood was always being told that she was fat and not good enough. "My dad always made me feel like I had to try...He ruined the deep seed of my existence...my confidence...my swag...He made me feel ugly...therefore I was," she added.

57.title: Today’s India is like plane flying in reverse, it’s headed for crash: Arundhati Roy
57.article_body: Author Arundhati Roy on Wednesday compared "today’s India" to a plane moving in reverse which is "headed for a crash". "The leaders of this country are flying the plane in reverse, everything is falling, and we are headed for a crash," Roy added. She was speaking at the launch of the book "Why do you fear my way so much?"

58.title: Oh my God: PM Modi to Indian journalists not allowed to cover event in Berlin
58.article_body: A video of PM Narendra Modi exclaiming 'Oh my God!' to Indian journalists in Germany has gone viral on social media. The incident took place when the journalists complained to PM Modi that they were not allowed to cover an event in Berlin. Reacting to it, PM Modi said, "Oh my God!" and added that he will inquire about it.

59.title: There hasn't been a better spell in his IPL career: Irfan on Maxwell’s 2/22 vs CSK
59.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan praised RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell for registering figures of 2/22 against CSK, stating that there hasn't been a better spell in the 33-year-old's IPL career. "He bowled with his brain...the turning point...came through him...Maxwell dismissed the two batters who play spin the best," Irfan added. Maxwell dismissed Robin Uthappa and Ambati Rayudu.

60.title: Couldn't have added anything to Congress: Prashant on declining offer
60.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor said that he "couldn't have added anything to Congress". "There were thorough discussions on the ways required for the betterment of the party...I am grateful that they listened to me. But I felt I won't be able to add anything to the party. Hence, I declined the offer," he added.

61.title: Father of boy who sang for PM Modi in Germany responds after Kamra posts edited video
61.article_body: After comedian Kunal Kamra posted an edited video of the boy who sang a patriotic song for PM Narendra Modi in Germany, his father tweeted, "Though he is still very young but certainly he loves his country more than you Mr Kamra or Kachra whatever you are." "Try to work on your poor jokes," he wrote.

62.title: Will always be there rooting for you: Ajay as Akshay completes 30 yrs in B'wood
62.article_body: As actor Akshay Kumar completed 30 years in the Bollywood industry, his close friend, actor Ajay Devgn, shared a note on his social media handle and wished him a successful journey ahead. He wrote, "Congratulations Akki. 30 years in cinema and several more decades to come. Hope you set new records. Will always be there rooting & cheering for you."

63.title: 1,500 mosques, 1,300 temples allowed to use loudspeakers in Maha: Police
63.article_body: Approximately 1,500 mosques and 1,300 temples in Maharashtra, excluding Mumbai have been given permission to use loudspeakers amid the ongoing issue on the use of loudspeakers in religious places, police said on Wednesday. "Preventative action taken against more than 2,300 people. Notice...given to around 7,000 persons on 3rd-4th May," Maharashtra Police added.

64.title: 5 killed, 4 injured after auto-rickshaw collides with truck in MP
64.article_body: Five people died and four others were injured after an auto-rickshaw collided head-on with a mini truck in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen district on Thursday. The accident took place around 3 am near Tedia bridge when the auto-rickshaw was heading towards Bhopal. Four occupants of the auto-rickshaw and a minor girl travelling in the truck were killed, an official said.

65.title: I regret WhatsApp's $22 bn sale to Facebook: WhatsApp's ex-CBO Arora
65.article_body: WhatsApp's former Chief Business Officer (CBO) Neeraj Arora tweeted, "I helped negotiate the $22 billion sale to Facebook (in 2014). Today, I regret it." He said, "Our stance was very clear: No mining user data, No ads (ever), No cross-platform tracking...Of course, that's not what happened." He added, "Today...WhatsApp is a shadow of the product we poured our hearts into."

66.title: Wish my life was as interesting as it sounded: Kriti on link-up rumours
66.article_body: When asked what she thinks about the link-up rumours with her co-stars, actress Kriti Sanon said, "These petty things...don't bother me at all." "It just makes you feel like 'I wish my life was as interesting as it sounded it to be'," she added. Kriti further said that she knows all of this is a part of being a celebrity.

67.title: 40-year-old Noida woman threatens to jump from balcony, police rescue her
67.article_body: Noida Police rescued and brought back to safety a 40-year-old woman, who was allegedly standing on her balcony and was threatening to jump. Officials said that the Noida Police reached the woman's house, talked to her and brought her inside the house from the balcony. Police said that the woman was going through a depressive phase due to marital dispute.

68.title: 3 held, 37 detained after stone-pelting reported in Delhi's Welcome area
68.article_body: Delhi Police arrested three people and detained 37 others after a stone-pelting incident was reported in the national capital's Welcome area on Wednesday night. According to the police, first, the quarrel took place between the children from both the groups, then it spread to the people of the two communities resulting in stone-pelting. Further investigation is underway, police said.

69.title: 22-yr-old man makes hoax calls about blowing up Unnao railway station, held
69.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested for making two hoax calls and threatening to blow up the Ganga Ghat railway station in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao. "We formed a team, traced the calls and arrested the youth within 24 hours," a police official said. The accused made both the calls on May 2.

70.title: Chennai man who died in police custody had 13 wounds: Post-mortem report
70.article_body: Post-mortem report of the 25-year-old man, Vignesh, who had died in police custody in Chennai last month, has revealed that he had 13 different wounds, including 12 contusions and one abrasion. Earlier, a CCTV footage showing policemen running after him and beating him had surfaced online. He had been arrested on April 18 over alleged possession of marijuana.

71.title: I feel like what the guys in 'Lagaan' movie felt: RCB's Harshal Patel on win vs CSK
71.article_body: Referring to their 13-run win against CSK, RCB bowling all-rounder Harshal Patel said, "Very satisfying. I feel like what the guys in 'Lagaan' movie felt after they won the match and it started raining." He added, "It was a drought for the team and myself as well. Really happy that we're over that now." Harshal took three wickets against CSK.

72.title: Warning issued for fresh spell of heatwave over 6 states/UTs; list released
72.article_body: The IMD has said that a fresh spell of heatwave conditions is likely to commence over northwest India from May 7 and over central India from May 8. Heatwave conditions are likely over north Madhya Maharashtra on May 5, over Rajasthan between May 7-9, over south Haryana, Delhi, southwest Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh and Vidarbha on May 8 and 9.

73.title: Woman found alive almost 6 days after China building collapse
73.article_body: A woman was pulled alive from the rubble of a building that partially collapsed on April 29 in China's Changsha, state media reported on Thursday. Officials said at least five people have died as a result of the collapse. Authorities have arrested nine people, including the owner of the building, on suspicion of ignoring building codes or committing other violations.

74.title: Rahul, Priyanka should visit Raj & witness violent incidents: BJP leader
74.article_body: BJP state in-charge Arun Singh has asked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to return from Nepal at the soonest and visit Rajasthan following Jodhpur violence. "He (Rahul) and Priyanka Gandhi should visit the state and witness the violent incidents," Singh added. "He should instruct the state government to maintain law and order and not indulge in appeasement politics," Singh stated.

75.title: 2 open fire in Bhajanpura, Delhi Police personnel's husband injured
75.article_body: Delhi Police has said that the preliminary investigation into the Bhajanpura firing on Wednesday revealed that two people opened fire upon another duo over personal enmity. Two people, including a Delhi Police personnel's husband, were injured in the firing. The prime suspect was having personal enmity with one of the victims on the issue of a love affair, police added.

76.title: Tomato prices soar in Bengaluru amid supply shortage
76.article_body: The rates of vegetables in Bengaluru have increased due to rise in temperature and the price of tomatoes has almost reached ₹50-65/kilogram. "The production of tomatoes in neighbouring Maharashtra has dropped over last few weeks and hence, the supply has been hit," an official said. The prices of beans and cauliflowers have also increased due to a shortage in supply.

77.title: It compelled me to do things I had never done before: Ayushmann on 'Anek'
77.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said his character 'Joshua' in the upcoming film 'Anek' "compelled" him to do things he had never done before, physically and mentally. "I gave this role my best shot to bring life to everything director Anubhav Sinha envisioned for the film," added Ayushmann. Discussing 'Anek', Anubhav termed it as his "most challenging" film so far.

78.title: If DC lose against SRH, their campaign might derail: Ajay Jadeja
78.article_body: Ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said DC's match against SRH on Thursday is crucial for the Rishabh Pant-led side as their campaign might derail if they lose the game. "They've played one game lesser than other franchises, but have only eight points...this is a hugely significant moment for DC," he added. DC have won four of their nine games so far.

79.title: RSS, BJP planned to incite riots in Jodhpur, Karauli: Rajasthan CM
79.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said that the RSS and BJP were planning to incite riots in Karauli, Jodhpur and Ramgarh. "They (RSS and BJP) are setting agenda…We took timely action and due to that only small incidents occurred but we've arrested culprits and won't spare anyone," Gehlot added. "We will not allow violence in the state," Gehlot stated.

80.title: Shah flags off boat ambulance at BSF's floating outpost in Bengal
80.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday flagged off a boat ambulance at a floating BSF outpost, which he inaugurated, in West Bengal. Shah is on a two-day visit to the state in which he is scheduled to attend various events. He was received at the Kolkata airport by BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari and MoS Home Nisith Pramanik.

81.title: Can't afford US anti-submarine helicopters: Taiwan
81.article_body: Taiwan on Thursday signalled that it has abandoned a plan to buy advanced new anti-submarine warfare helicopters from the US, saying, "The price is too high, beyond the scope of our country's ability." Taiwan is currently undertaking a military modernisation programme to improve its capabilities to fend off any Chinese attack. China claims democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory.

82.title: I tell Arjun I want to grow old with him, I know he's my man: Malaika
82.article_body: Speaking about her boyfriend-actor Arjun Kapoor, actress Malaika Arora said they are at a place where they think about 'what next'. "We'd love to see a future together and see where we can take it from here," she added. "I...tell him...'I want to grow old with you'. We'll figure out the rest, but I know he's my man," Malaika said.

83.title: FIR against e-commerce site for selling abortion kits without prescription
83.article_body: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has registered a case against an e-commerce website for selling abortion kits without a prescription. A food inspector at FDA placed an order for medical termination of pregnancy (MTP) pill on Amazon without providing a doctor's prescription and received the delivery after a few days. The FDA also found discrepancy in the seller ID.

84.title: NDMC seals 14 unlicensed meat shops, seizes 500 kg of meat in Delhi
84.article_body: North Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) on Wednesday sealed 14 unlicensed meat shops and seized around 500 kg of meat in Delhi. Out of this, 10 shops were sealed in the City-Sadar Paharganj zone, three in Narela zone and one in Rohini zone. "The goal was to maintain public health standards as, during summer, eatables spoil easily," an NDMC official said.

85.title: Williamson has to work on his batting, it's a massive concern: Chawla
85.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said SRH captain Kane Williamson needs to work on his batting, adding that his performances with the bat are a "massive concern". "Williamson is a player around whom the entire [SRH] batting unit revolves," stated Chawla. Williamson has scored 195 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 99.48.

86.title: 35 passengers escape unhurt after bus catches fire in Nagpur
86.article_body: As many as 35 passengers escaped unhurt after a bus caught fire near the Reserve Bank square in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Thursday, a fire official said. The blaze started from the engine side, following which the passengers quickly got down from the bus, the official added. The bus, run by the civic body, was going to Khaparkheda, the official stated.

87.title: Sedition law should not be struck down: Centre tells Supreme Court
87.article_body: The sedition law should not be struck down but there is a need for guidelines, Centre told the Supreme Court. Attorney General KK Venugopal argued that a law may not become invalid just because it's been misused. Meanwhile, Kapil Sibal, the lawyer representing petitioners, invoked Mahatma Gandhi saying, "Mahatma said it is a right to create disaffection against the government."

88.title: Woman dragged by car as she tries to intervene between 2 arguing drivers in Delhi
88.article_body: A woman was allegedly dragged and slapped by two men in a car in Delhi's Amar Colony. The woman reportedly tried to intervene in an argument taking place between two drivers when the incident took place. One of the accused was arrested by the police and identified as 25-year-old Udayvir Singh, a resident of Faridabad.

89.title: Not concerned about Jadeja's form: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming
89.article_body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming has said he's not concerned about all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's form in IPL 2022. "When you are batting at number five or six, you don't get a lot of time to get the tempo or rhythm right," explained Fleming. So far, Jadeja has scored 116 runs in 10 games. He was dismissed for 3(5) vs RCB.

90.title: Klopp's big chance to get revenge: Wenger on Liverpool-Madrid CL final
90.article_body: Discussing the Champions League final between Liverpool and Real Madrid, ex-Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger said, "This is [Liverpool manager] Jurgen Klopp's big chance to get...revenge [for] the 2018 CL final." Madrid defeated Liverpool 3-1 in the final of the 2018 edition of the Champions League. Real Madrid beat Manchester City 6-5 on aggregate in their Champions League semi-final this edition.

91.title: Heard breaks down in court, says 'When Depp slapped me for 1st time, it changed my life'
91.article_body: Actress Amber Heard broke down in the court while testifying in her ex-husband's Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her. Amber alleged Depp slapped her for the first time in 2012 after she had asked him about his tattoo. "I'd never been hit like that. He slapped me for no reason. I'll never forget it, it changed my life," Heard added.

92.title: Salman bhai played the perfect host, he was last to leave: Aayush on Eid party
92.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma said his brother-in-law, Salman Khan, was the perfect host at the Eid party, which was hosted by the former and his wife Arpita Khan. "Salman bhai wanted to do it in a grand way and suggested...we host it at our home," he added. "He took care of...the guests...In fact, he was the last to leave," Aayush said.

93.title: Delhi to see partly cloudy skies, thunder and lightning today: IMD
93.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted partly cloudy skies with possibility of thunder and lightning in Delhi today. According to IMD, the maximum temperature is likely to settle around 38°C today. Though western disturbances recently brought relief to Northwest India, the maximum temperature is likely to rise by three to four degrees during the next three days, IMD said.

94.title: Men, boys being raped by Russian soldiers in Ukraine
94.article_body: Russian soldiers in Ukraine have been allegedly raping men and boys, United Nations and Ukrainian officials said. "It's hard for women and girls to report rape because of stigma amongst other reasons, but it's often even harder for men and boys to report," Special Representative of the Secretary-General on Sexual Violence in Conflict, Pramila Patten, said.

95.title: He will have no place even here: Lalu on Prashant Kishor's return to Bihar
95.article_body: Reacting to poll strategist Prashant Kishor's announcement that he will "start from Bihar", RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav said that he has come back to Bihar as people everywhere else have sent him back. He will have no place even here, he added. On May 2, Kishor tweeted, "Time to go to the Real Masters."

96.title: Railways to run its first 'Bharat Gaurav' train on June 21
96.article_body: Railways will run its first 'Bharat Gaurav' train on June 21, which would include a stop at Nepal's Janakpur, the Railways said. The train will take people on an 18-day tour covering prominent places associated with life of Lord Ram. The first stop of the train will be in Ayodhya. The price of tour package starts from ₹62,370 per person.

97.title: Prashant Kishor announces 3,000-km Bihar 'padyatra', says no party for now
97.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Thursday said that he will carry out a 3,000-kilometre 'padyatra' in Bihar beginning October 2 amid speculations that he is going to form a new political party. However, Kishor said that he is not going to form a political party as of now. "I am going to talk to around 17,000-18,000 people," he added.

98.title: Robbers tamper with ATM, escape with cash in Pune; police launch hunt
98.article_body: Two unidentified suspects allegedly tampered with the sensor of the cash dispenser at an ATM kiosk in Pune's Model Colony and fled with ₹5,000 cash that a user failed to withdraw due to malfunction. Pune City Police have launched a search for the two suspects. The incident reportedly took place on April 27 between 11:50 am and 12:20 pm.

99.title: Mumbai's Kokilaben Hospital completes 4,500 robot-assisted surgeries
99.article_body: The Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital has received its third da Vinci Robotic Surgical System and has completed 4,500 robot-assisted surgeries. It has also become the first hospital to have completed 2,600 robot-assisted surgeries for patients with prostate, kidney and urinary bladder cancer. The hospital had introduced the system in June 2012.

100.title: I don't have a chance: Ex-world no. 1 Murray on match against Djokovic
100.article_body: Discussing his upcoming match against world number one Novak Djokovic in the third round of the Madrid Open 2022, former world number one Andy Murray said, "In theory, I should have no chance in the match." "It's a great opportunity for me," added Murray. Murray will face Djokovic for the first time since the Qatar Open final in 2017.

101.title: Man stabbed to death in suspected honour killing case in Hyderabad
101.article_body: A man was stabbed to death by two persons in Hyderabad's Saroornagar on Wednesday in a suspected case of honour killing, police said. The man and his wife, riding a bike, were attacked with an iron rod following which the latter was injured, police added. Two brothers of the deceased man's wife have been identified as the accused.

102.title: 4 kids drown in MP dam, CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for kin
102.article_body: Four kids, including one boy and three girls, died after drowning in the Machagora dam in Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district. Expressing grief over the incident, Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each to the families of the victims. "I pray for the peace of the innocent children's souls and strength for the family," he tweeted.

103.title: 20 IAS officers among 33 bureaucrats transferred by J&K administration
103.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir administration on Wednesday ordered the transfer of 33 bureaucrats including 20 IAS officers. Divisional commissioner of Jammu and six deputy commissioners are among those transferred with immediate effect. While senior IAS officer Ashok Parmar has been posted as Principal Secretary of Jal Shakti Department, IAS officer Avny Lavasa has been posted as Deputy Commissioner of Jammu.

104.title: Man, out in forest with female friend, killed by tiger in Maha
104.article_body: A 21-year-old man, who was out in the forest with his female friend, was killed by a tiger in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district on Tuesday. According to a forest official, the couple, riding a two-wheeler, ventured deep into the Ussegaon forest. The tiger suddenly pounced on the victim, identified as Ajit Nakade, and dragged him away, said the official.

105.title: 2 including Nigerian national cheat people of ₹2.75 cr, held by Ahmedabad Police
105.article_body: Two persons, including a 39-year-old Nigerian national from Mumbai, were arrested by the Ahmedabad Cyber Crime Cell for allegedly cheating 13 persons to the tune of ₹2.75 crore in guise of exporting herbal extract. "Their modus operandi was to connect with people on social media and seek their interest in doing business with a fake Poland-based company," an official said.

106.title: He ripped my underwear off, shoved fingers inside me looking for cocaine: Heard on Depp
106.article_body: While testifying in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her, actress Amber Heard claimed during a weekend getaway in May 2013, the actor sexually abused her. She added that Depp ripped her dress and underwear off and conducted a cavity search to look for cocaine. "He...shoved his fingers inside me...I just stood there staring at the stupid light," Heard said.

107.title: Novak Djokovic knows how to defend his justice: Vladimir Kamelzon
107.article_body: Russian coach Vladimir Kamelzon said world number one Novak Djokovic knows how to defend his justice, adding that Djokovic is a unique person who has his own opinion. "In my eyes, he is the number one player in the history of tennis. He has a special relationship," stated Kamelzon. "Djokovic is the first racket of the world," said Kamelzon.

108.title: Mom says rats nibbled infant's knees in J'khand, probe panel set up
108.article_body: Mother of a girl child who was born on April 29 said that her child's knees had allegedly been nibbled by rats at a hospital in Jharkhand. The infant was rushed to another hospital in critical condition but is stable now. Reports said that a committee to probe the incident has been set up after family's complaints.

109.title: Fan shares pic of Livingstone's 'crocodile' catching style, cricketer says 'My bad habit'
109.article_body: A cricket fan took to Twitter to share a picture of PBKS' Liam Livingstone's catching style, comparing it to a crocodile opening and closing its mouth. "It's the end result that matters...right? It's a bad habit of mine I've always done," the cricketer responded to the fan. "Was Jonty Rhodes okay with this catching technique of yours?" another fan commented.

110.title: Trainees forced to drink human semen with fish sauce by Navy officer in Thailand
110.article_body: A Navy officer in Thailand has been jailed after video footage that allegedly showed him forcing trainee marines to drink human semen mixed with fish sauce surfaced online. The clip was filmed at a naval training camp in Chon Buri's Sattahip district in October but surfaced last week. Senior officials apologised to the trainees and their families for the abuse.

111.title: Bangladeshi girl rescued from prostitution in Andhra Pradesh
111.article_body: A Bangladeshi girl was rescued from prostitution in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam by the city police on Wednesday. The girl reportedly entered India illegally and stayed in Kolkata for a few days with a person named Munir. He later sent the girl to Visakhapatnam, where two other accused introduced her to prostitution and confined her in a house, police said.

112.title: HC upholds Osmania University decision to deny Rahul Gandhi visit
112.article_body: The Telangana High Court has upheld Hyderabad's Osmania University's decision to deny Congress leader Rahul Gandhi a visit to meet students on May 7. The Congress party had moved the court after the university rejected an application for the visit. Youth leaders of the party had protested against the university's decision, while students affiliated with ABVP and TRS organised counter-protests.

113.title: Without Lomror, RCB wouldn't have reached 173 vs CSK: Sehwag
113.article_body: Praising RCB all-rounder Mahipal Lomror for his performance against CSK, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said RCB wouldn't have reached 173/8 without the 22-year-old's knock of 42 off 27 deliveries. "It was an important, crucial innings from Lomror. He set the platform for Dinesh Karthik to do his work," added Sehwag. RCB defeated CSK by 13 runs in the game.

114.title: I've never leaked a sex tape, the Kardashians have abused my name: Ray J
114.article_body: Discussing his sex tape featuring then-girlfriend Kim Kardashian, which leaked in 2007, singer Ray J said, "I have never leaked a sex tape in my life." "I have sat in the shadows for over 14 years allowing the Kardashians to...abuse my name, make billions of dollars over a decade and a half talking about a topic I've never...[discussed]," added Ray.

115.title: Let's hope we haven't left it too late and can peak towards the end: Maxwell
115.article_body: After defeating CSK to register their sixth win in IPL 2022, RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said they're going in the right direction and can hopefully peak towards the end of the league stage. "[Hopefully, we can] find a way into the top four...do some damage in the finals," he added. Maxwell dismissed Robin Uthappa and Ambati Rayudu in the match.

116.title: Colombia extradites 'world's most dangerous drug trafficker' to US
116.article_body: Colombia has extradited Dairo Antonio Usuga, alias Otoniel, who'd been the country's most-wanted drug lord before his capture, to the US. He's wanted in America for crimes including drug trafficking, conspiracy and illegally possessing weapons. Colombian President Ivan Duque said Otoniel wasn't only the "world's most dangerous drug trafficker" but also a "murderer" and "abuser of boys and girls".

117.title: Chandigarh resident cheated of ₹4 lakh while trying to update KYC
117.article_body: A Chandigarh resident was cheated of ₹4.34 lakh minutes after he clicked a web link shared on his mobile phone to update KYC details pertaining to his savings bank account. The person who called the victim had introduced himself as a bank representative. The link was shared from a mobile number which was later found registered to a fake identity.

118.title: Been 1 year, it's as painful as 1st day: Nikki on brother's death anniversary
118.article_body: Actress Nikki Tamboli shared a video of her late brother on his first death anniversary and said that the last one year has been the longest for her. "One year has passed since you left...After a year, it is still as painful as the first day...I will always know that I'll never get to hug you again," she wrote.

119.title: NDMC sets up separate registration counters for suspected COVID patients
119.article_body: Amid rise in COVID-19 cases in the national capital, the North Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) has set up separate registration counters for suspected coronavirus patients at its health facilities. In a statement, the NDMC added that it will also "provide one month's advance medicines to patients suffering from chronic diseases". Notably, Delhi reported 1,354 fresh Covid-19 cases on Wednesday.

120.title: Tamil Nadu Governor sends anti-NEET bill for President's approval
120.article_body: After re-enactment of a bill seeking exemption for Tamil Nadu students from the National Entrance-cum-Eligibility Test (NEET), Governor RN Ravi sent the anti-NEET bill to the Centre for President's approval. "Bill will be rejected by the President," state BJP chief K Annamalai said. Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam workers had protested against the Governor for not sending the bill to the President.

121.title: BJP 'hero' in publicity, Cong failed to publicise its work: Ghulam Nabi
121.article_body: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said that BJP government is a "hero" in publicity and called Congress "zero". "Their (BJP) government is a hero in publicity but we were zero in publicity…completely zero...It's good, I appreciate them and I blame myself, my government and my party that we failed miserably, whatever we did we could not publicise," Azad added.

122.title: Diego Maradona's 'Hand of God' shirt sells for world-record £7.14 million at auction
122.article_body: The shirt that late Argentine legend Diego Maradona wore when he scored 'Hand of God' goal against England in 1986 World Cup sold for a world-record price of £7.14 million at a London auction. It surpasses the previous records for a match-worn jersey and a piece of sports memorabilia. Maradona had also scored 'Goal of the Century' in that match.

123.title: Biometric data for Aadhaar can't be used to identify criminals: UIDAI to Delhi HC
123.article_body: Biometric data collected for Aadhaar cannot be used to identify criminals or solve crimes, the UIDAI has told Delhi High Court. It said that sharing or use of biometric information for purposes other than the generation of the Aadhaar number is "impermissible" under the Aadhaar Act, 2016. It added that it anyway doesn't collect biometric information suitable for forensic purposes.

124.title: 2 arrested with heroin worth ₹3 crore in Nagaland's Kohima
124.article_body: Nagaland Police arrested two persons and allegedly seized 615 gram of heroin from them in Kohima on Wednesday. According to the police, the seized amount of drug is valued at ₹3 crore in the international market. Giving details about the incident, police said, "We have intercepted one suspicious vehicle and recovered 49 packets of suspected heroin."

125.title: Not stepping into someone's shoes: Kiara on comparison with Vidya in 'Bhool...'
125.article_body: Kiara Advani said she's "not stepping into someone's shoes" in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' after her performance is being compared to Vidya Balan's performance in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa'. Kiara added they've tried to retain the essence of the original film and some elements including Manjulika's name. "This isn't a psychological thriller but a horror-comedy. There's a layer of black magic," she said.

126.title: Russia resorting to missile terrorism to spread fear: Ukraine
126.article_body: Amid intense bombardment by Russian forces, Ukraine has accused them of using  "missile terrorism". Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said that Russia is "resorting to the missile terrorism tactics in order to spread fear across Ukraine." Meanwhile, the Russian military said that it used missiles to destroy power facilities at five railway stations across Ukraine.

127.title: US intelligence helped Ukraine kill Russian generals: Report
127.article_body: The US provided Ukraine with intelligence that allowed them to target and kill many of the Russian generals who've died in the ongoing war, The New York Times reported citing senior American officials. The report said Ukraine combined location and other details from US with their own intelligence to conduct artillery strikes and other attacks that have killed Russian officers.

128.title: Taliban force Shias to break Eid fast early: Report
128.article_body: The Taliban reportedly forced Shia Muslims in Afghanistan to break their fasts before the Shia announcement of Eid. They also barred Shia mosques from holding Eid prayers, said reports. "Taliban forces prohibited dozens of Shia mosques from holding Eid prayers…Shia activists reported this violation of religious rights in Herat and Kabul," local journalist Massoud Hossaini said on Twitter.

129.title: Internet services suspended in Bhilwara for 24 hours after attack on 2 people
129.article_body: Internet services were suspended in the Bhilwara city in Rajasthan for 24 hours, District Collector Ashish Modi said on Thursday. This comes after two people were attacked by unknown persons when they were having food in the Sanganer area on Wednesday night. "Their bike was also set ablaze. We are investigating the matter," Modi added.

130.title: IT firm offers free matchmaking service to staff, hike on getting married in TN
130.article_body: An IT company headquartered in Madurai offers its employees free matchmaking service and a hike when they get married. "Employees treat me like a brother and several of them are from villages, with either aged parents or lacking a proper outlook of the world and unable to find the right match," CEO of Sri Mookambika Infosolutions MP Selvaganesh said.

131.title: Russia practises simulated nuclear-capable missile strikes
131.article_body: Russia on Wednesday said its forces practised simulated nuclear-capable missile strikes in the western enclave of Kaliningrad, amid the war in Ukraine. The forces practised single and multiple strikes at targets imitating launchers of missile systems, airfields, protected infrastructure, military equipment and command posts of a mock enemy, the Russian Defence Ministry added.

132.title: Real Madrid pull off comeback to defeat Man City, reach Champions League final
132.article_body: Real Madrid entered the Champions League final after defeating Manchester City 6-5 on aggregate in the semi-final. In the semi-final's second leg on Wednesday night, Madrid trailed 1-0 and 5-3 on aggregate heading into the 90th minute when Rodrygo scored twice to send the game to extra time. Karim Benzema then scored an extra-time penalty to win the tie.

133.title: India has seen communal tensions since 7th century: BJP leader CT Ravi
133.article_body: BJP leader CT Ravi on Wednesday said communal tension is not new in India. "It started from the first attack on India in the 7th century, not from today," Ravi said. "Some people try to create communal tension. There are some intolerant faiths," he added. His remarks came following recent communal clashes reported from across the country.

134.title: There is a swimming pool in PM Modi's plane: Adhir Chowdhury
134.article_body: Reacting to BJP's criticism on Rahul Gandhi's Nepal tour, Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury said that there is a swimming pool in PM Narendra Modi's new plane, reported Times Now citing media reports. Chowdhury also claimed that PM Modi bought two planes worth ₹13,000 crore and used to take bath in the pool while travelling to foreign countries, the report said.

135.title: 150 MNS workers arrested in Nashik for allegedly creating communal tension
135.article_body: As many as 150 workers from the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) were arrested in Nashik for allegedly creating communal tension in the district, local police officials informed. The arrests have been made as part of preventive actions taken to maintain law and order in the state, following MNS chief Raj Thackeray's appeal to play Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers outside mosques.

136.title: India has sufficient stock of wheat to sustain for a year: Centre
136.article_body: India currently has more than the required quantity of wheat in stocks to sustain for a year, Sudhanshu Pandey, Secretary, Department of Food and Public Distribution, said. Due to an increase in the market prices and higher demand by the private players, both for domestic and export purposes, farmers are getting a good price for the wheat, Sudhanshu added.

137.title: Couldn't sleep during Love Hostel, broke down on set; spoke to therapist: Sanya
137.article_body: Actress Sanya Malhotra said that her character from 'Love Hostel' was emotionally overwhelming for her. "During the shoot, I remember not being able to sleep at night and feeling uneasy all day. In fact, I remember breaking down on the set of the film one day. That's when I spoke to my therapist," she added.

138.title: 'Jayeshbhai' and I are both accidental heroes: Ranveer on 'Jayeshbhai...'
138.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he and his character 'Jayeshbhai' in his upcoming film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' are both "accidental heroes". "There are several parallels between my life and 'Jayeshbhai's' life. In playing 'Jayeshbhai', I was able to tap into my own...experiences," added Ranveer. "With the odds stacked against yourself, you turn to the power that love gives you," stated Ranveer.

139.title: Mumbai man held for 18th time over sexual abuse, was addicted to adult content
139.article_body: A 30-year-old Mumbai-based man was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a minor girl who was playing in her housing society. The police found that the accused had already been arrested 17 times before in cases of molestation and kidnapping. The accused got addicted to watching adult content when he was younger, after which he started molesting women, the police said.

140.title: A journey from ₹1000 to ₹30 lacs, meet Avinash Koneru: Adda52
140.article_body: Adda52 announced Avinash Koneru as the winner of its Big Millions Tournament. The brand revealed that the Bangalore-based IT professional qualified through a ₹1,100 buy-in satellite tournament and received a sum of ₹31,63,652 from the prize pool of ₹2 crore, adding that he is the true epitome of what one can achieve with continuous efforts and dedication.

141.title: Journalist attacked with iron rod, robbed of cash in Punjab's Zirakpur
141.article_body: A media person, Alok Verma, who works in a vernacular daily published from Panchkula, was attacked with an iron rod by unknown bikers on Tuesday in Punjab's Zirakpur. The attackers, who followed him while he was going home, reportedly hit him on the head with the rod and took away his cash and cell phone. Verma has been hospitalised.

142.title: BSF discovers suspected tunnel near Indo-Pak border in J&K
142.article_body: The BSF on Wednesday detected a suspected tunnel near India-Pakistan border in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district. A small opening was found near the fencing in the Samba area during patrolling by BSF personnel at around 5:30 pm, according to reports quoting sources. The officials said almost a fortnight ago, two Jaish-e-Mohammed suicide bombers, who infiltrated from Pakistan, were killed.

143.title: There have been many reasons: Mrunal on Jersey's box office failure
143.article_body: Speaking about Jersey's poor performance at the box office, actress Mrunal Thakur said that it's disappointing. "There have been many external reasons. But yes, one does tend to feel low. Anyway, we will work harder next time," she added. Mrunal said she has "no idea" what audiences want, especially after the success of South Indian films like 'RRR' and 'Pushpa'.

144.title: Railway collects ₹2.4 crore as fines for ticketless travel in Pune
144.article_body: Pune Railway Division collected ₹2.47 crore in the month of April as fines from 36,579 ticketless travellers, its highest monthly collection. Another 101 passengers were fined ₹46,629 for travelling in an improper way, including travelling while being drunk. "Passengers unable to pay fine will be arrested by the railway police," Manoj Jhawar, spokesperson for Pune Railway Division, said.

145.title: India reports 3,275 new COVID-19 cases, 55 deaths in 24 hours
145.article_body: India has reported 3,275 COVID-19 cases, 3,010 recoveries and 55 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,205 COVID-19 cases and 31 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,719, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,975.

146.title: Virat Kohli's aggressive celebration after MS Dhoni's dismissal goes viral, fans react
146.article_body: A video of RCB batter Virat Kohli's aggressive celebration after CSK captain MS Dhoni's dismissal in their IPL 2022 match went viral. Reacting to the celebration, a fan tweeted, "Can't match the aggression he shows while wearing RCB jersey." "Dhoni fans taking their frustration out on Kohli's routine celebration is peak Twitter," wrote another.

147.title: Fake Whatsapp account created in Lok Sabha Speaker's name, 3 arrested
147.article_body: A fake WhatsApp account was created in Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla's name following which three persons were arrested by the Odisha Police. "Some miscreants have created a fake account in my name with profile photo and sending messages to MPs...Matter has been reported to authorities...Please ignore calls/messages from these and other numbers and inform my office," the Speaker tweeted.

148.title: I've been trying to improve my sequencing: Harshal on 3/35 vs CSK
148.article_body: RCB pacer Harshal Patel, who was named Man of the Match for his performance against CSK, has said he has been trying to improve his sequencing in the ongoing IPL season. "When people are waiting for the slower balls, my hard length balls and my yorkers are released," he added. Harshal dismissed Moeen Ali, Ravindra Jadeja and Dwaine Pretorius.

149.title: BMC to make EV charging points mandatory in new buildings across Mumbai
149.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to make electric vehicle (EV) charging points compulsory in new buildings that would come up in Mumbai. "To encourage developers to install charging stations...offering incentives is also being discussed," a BMC official said. Moreover, the BMC is also planning to set up charging stations at 28 locations in municipal properties, he added.

150.title: He could make Twitter 'worse', but we should not underestimate him: Gates on Musk
150.article_body: At an event hosted by The Wall Street Journal, Bill Gates said Elon Musk actually could make Twitter "worse". "That's not his track record. I mean his track record with Tesla and SpaceX is pretty mind blowing...I kind of doubt that will happen this time, but we should have an open mind and never underestimate Elon," Gates added.

151.title: What let us down against RCB was batsmanship: MS Dhoni
151.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni said their batsmanship let them down against RCB as they lost by 13 runs on Wednesday. "When you're chasing...you have to...see what really the situation is demanding rather than playing your shots. [Our] shot selection could have been better towards the end," he added. RCB posted 173/8 and then restricted CSK to 160/8 to win.

152.title: I am not considered for any role by most casting directors: Inaamulhaq
152.article_body: Actor Inaamulhaq who featured in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Jolly LLB 2' which released in 2017, said he is not considered for "any role" by most casting directors. "I did 10 films in the last 10 years," added Inaamulhaq. "For [my film] 'Nakkash', I got a few awards but nothing major as there's a different rule for actors like us," stated Inaamulhaq.

153.title: Dalit groom forced by villagers to get down from horse in U’khand
153.article_body: A Dalit groom was allegedly forced by some villagers to dismount a horse at his wedding in Uttarakhand’s Almora. The groom’s father filed a complaint with the SDM stating that villagers threatened to kill his son if he did not get down from the horse on Monday. The district administration has ordered a probe to verify the complaint, officials said.

154.title: Viral video shows man selling drugs on Punjab railway track, 7 held
154.article_body: Police have arrested seven people after a video of drug addicts crowding around a man openly selling drugs on a rail track in Faridkot went viral. "Taking immediate action, the accused has been arrested under relevant sections. Faridkot Police is fully committed in its fight against drugs," Faridkot SSP said. Navjot Singh Sidhu had shared the video on Twitter.

155.title: School bus catches fire after falling in burning field in Punjab, 2 injured
155.article_body: Two students were injured after a school bus caught fire after overturning and falling into a burning wheat field in Punjab's Gurdaspur on Wednesday. The incident took place at around 1:30 pm when children were being taken back home from school. FIR stated that smoke from field created zero visibility, during which, driver lost control and bus went off road.

156.title: Patiala law university declared containment zone as 60 students test COVID +ve
156.article_body: Rajiv Gandhi National University of Law (RGNUL) in Punjab's Patiala has been declared a containment zone after 60 students tested positive for COVID-19 in the last two days. "Those positive have mild symptoms and are isolated in separate blocks," Patiala DC Sakshi Sawhney said. The district administration has asked the university to get the hostels vacated by May 10.

157.title: There was zero publicity for Special OPS, hoardings were pulled down: Neeraj
157.article_body: Recalling how difficult it was to promote 'Special OPS' due to the outbreak of COVID-19, filmmaker Neeraj Pandey said the show solely survived on word of mouth. "There was zero marketing and publicity for 'Special OPS'," he added. "All our press meets were cancelled. The MCD had taken off all the hoardings to put up COVID-19 awareness posters," Neeraj said.

158.title: 34-yr-old man found dead in Chandigarh; drug overdose suspected
158.article_body: A 34-year-old daily wage labourer, who worked as a plumber, was found dead near Burail in Chandigarh under mysterious circumstances on Wednesday. Police are suspecting drug overdose behind the death, as a used syringe was found near the body. According to his family, the deceased was a drug addict. His viscera samples have been sent for forensic examination, police said.

159.title: BMC headquarters lit in purple and blue to raise awareness for Huntington's disease
159.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) illuminated its headquarters in purple and blue lights on Wednesday to raise awareness about Huntington's disease. The disease is an incurable genetic ailment that affects the brain and is caused due to  production of a disease-causing huntingtin protein. "We express solidarity with patients and families that are affected by it," the BMC said.

160.title: Loudspeakers should be banned: Minorities Commission chief
160.article_body: National Commission for Minorities chief Iqbal Singh Lalpura said that loudspeakers should be banned at religious and other public places.  "Azaan must be there. But there is also an issue of noise pollution…Loudspeakers should be banned whether they are at religious places or markets, restaurants or anywhere else," he said. The Commission is there to protect minorities, he added.

161.title: GMR Group to run Hyderabad airport for 30 more years till 2068
161.article_body: GMR Hyderabad International Airport Limited, a step-down subsidiary of GMR Infrastructure Limited, will run Rajiv Gandhi International Airport for another 30 years till 2068. This comes after the Ministry of Civil Aviation extended the terms of the Concession Agreement from March 23, 2038 up to March 22, 2068. The extension is in terms of the agreement dated December 20, 2004.

162.title: Nepali singer tweets pic with Rahul Gandhi, says 'such humble, simple person'
162.article_body: Nepali singer Saraswoti Khatri has tweeted a photo with Rahul Gandhi. They were attending former CNN correspondent Sumnima Udas' wedding. Khatri wrote, "Music has the power to bring all people together. I had an honor to sing few songs for honorable member of Indian Parliament Mr Rahul Gandhi ji yesterday evening. I found him such humble & simple person."

163.title: Were always short of money while looking for house, struggled for yrs: Supriya
163.article_body: Actress Supriya Pathak said when she and husband Pankaj Kapur were looking to buy a house, they were always a little short of money. "My father-in-law...[said] we must not go for a rented house...It's better to pay instalments for a home loan...When we took loan, whatever money could have gone into rent, we paid that much in instalments," she added.

164.title: 9, including 2 minors, held for kidnapping & killing man in Bengaluru
164.article_body: Police have arrested nine people, including two minors, for allegedly kidnapping and killing a 33-year-old man in Bengaluru. Police suspect that one of the prime accused was in a relationship with the deceased's wife, which reportedly led to the murder. The victim, who was suffering from asthma, was reportedly locked inside a luggage carrier and died due to breathlessness.

165.title: Woman proposes to boyfriend in stands during RCB-CSK match, pics go viral
165.article_body: A woman proposed to her boyfriend in the stands during the RCB-CSK match at the MCA Stadium in Pune on Wednesday. Reacting to it, former India opener Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Smart girl proposing [to] an RCB fan. If he can stay loyal to RCB, he can definitely stay loyal to his partner...Well done and a good day to propose."

166.title: Mumbai's Dharavi reports 1st COVID-19 case since March 17
166.article_body: Mumbai's Dharavi reported one new case of COVID-19 on Wednesday, its first infection since March 17, a Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) official said. With this, Dharavi's overall count of COVID-19 cases reached 8,653, while death toll stood at 419, the official added. This comes as Mumbai reported 117 new coronavirus cases on Wednesday, its highest single-day tally since February 25.

167.title: Fire continues for 9th day at Delhi's Bhalswa landfill
167.article_body: Firefighters on Wednesday continued to douse the fire at Delhi's Bhalswa landfill, nine days after a massive fire broke out at the site last Tuesday. This is one of the longest operations as most fires, including ones at landfills, are doused in two-five days, Delhi Fire Services said. "The land is simply unapproachable...mounds are tall and unstable," an official said.

168.title: India calls for 'immediate end to hostilities' in Ukraine in joint statement with France
168.article_body: In a joint statement, India and France have called for "immediate end to hostilities" in Ukraine. "Both countries unequivocally condemned the fact that civilians have been killed in Ukraine, and called for an immediate cessation of hostilities in order for the two sides to come together...to put an immediate end to the suffering of the people," the statement read.

169.title: Mumbai doctor loses ₹1 lakh while buying discounted clothes online
169.article_body: A Mumbai doctor was cheated of ₹99,994 while purchasing discounted clothes online. Upon not receiving his order, he contacted the site's customer care but got no response. He later got a call from a person who identified himself as the company's executive and asked him to share details. The complainant later noticed four transactions worth ₹9,999 and two worth ₹20,000.

170.title: 2 dead, 1 injured after car hits electric pole on Palm Beach Road
170.article_body: While one person was grievously injured, two others died after their car hit the safety barrier and an electric pole on Navi Mumbai's Palm Beach Road on May 4. The survivor, Nitin Mathew, has been admitted to a hospital and his condition is serious. Since Mathew isn't in a condition to talk, we couldn't get much details, police said.

171.title: Father booked for negligence after son dies in bike accident near Panvel
171.article_body: A 36-year-old father has reportedly been booked for negligence after his five-year-old son died in a bike accident near Panvel. The man was riding his bike and his son was sitting on the bike's petrol tank when it collided head-on with a wall on a road's side. After the collision, the bike fell outside a bridge, causing injuries to them.

172.title: US Federal Reserve raises interest rates by 50 bps in the biggest hike in 22 years
172.article_body: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its benchmark overnight interest rate by 50 bps, citing elevated inflation. It's the second hike in two months by the US Fed and the largest increase since 2000, which brings the key rate to a range of 0.75% to 1%. US inflation reached 6.6% last month, the highest point in four decades.

173.title: RCB defeat CSK to end their 3-match losing streak, jump to 4th on points table
173.article_body: RCB defeated CSK by 13 runs in their IPL 2022 match at the MCA Stadium in Pune on Wednesday to end their three-match losing streak. With the win, RCB jumped to the fourth position on the points table. Mahipal Lomror top-scored for RCB with 42(27), while RCB bowling all-rounder Harshal Patel took three wickets in the match.

174.title: Identify and remove defects in power distribution: UP Energy Minister
174.article_body: Energy Minister AK Sharma made a spot inspection of the 33KV substation in Vibhuti Khand and issued instructions to ensure that the power supply was not disrupted because of avoidable local faults.
