He asked the officials to identify and remove deficiencies and minimise the occurrence of local power breakdowns. The preventive maintenance, he said, was the key to the problem.

175.title: Northeast India is natural gateway to Southeast Asia & beyond: Prez
175.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Wednesday said India's Northeast region is the natural gateway to Southeast Asia and beyond. "Northeast has immense inherent strengths. What it offers in terms of tourism, horticulture, handloom and sports is often unique," President Kovind said. He added that efforts are now required to be made to bring Northeast at par with industrially-advanced states.

176.title: Delhivery sets IPO price band at ₹462-487 to raise ₹5,235 cr
176.article_body: The price band for the upcoming IPO of logistics startup Delhivery will be ₹462-487/share, valuing the company at ₹35,283 crore. The IPO will open for subscription between May 11 and 13. It aims to raise ₹4,000 crore via fresh issue of shares and ₹1,235 crore through an offer for sale.  Delhivery had earlier planned to raise ₹7,460 crore.

177.title: Local languages' promotion responsibility of society, govt: President
177.article_body: While addressing the 61st annual conference of the Bodo Sahitya Sabha in Assam, President Ram Nath Kovind on Wednesday said that it's the responsibility of society and government to promote local languages. The President said that to keep any literature alive and relevant, the participation of the younger generation is very important, which is why young writers should be encouraged.

178.title: LinkedIn to pay female workers in US $1.75 mn over pay gap claims
178.article_body: LinkedIn has agreed to pay $1.75 million in back wages to 686 female workers after the US Labour Department alleged that they faced "systemic, gender-based pay discrimination". As per the complaint, from 2015 to 2017, women working in engineering, product or marketing roles at two of LinkedIn's offices were paid less than their male counterparts. LinkedIn has denied the allegation.

179.title: Waze paid encounter specialist ₹45 lakh to kill Mansukh Hiren: NIA
179.article_body:
National Investigation Agency (NIA) has stated in its affidavit that suspended Mumbai Police officer Sachin Waze paid ₹45 lakh to encounter specialist Pradeep Sharma to kill Mansukh Hiren.
Mansukh Hiren's body was found in the Mumbra Creek days after his stolen vehicle was found with gelatin sticks near Antilia, the residence of Mukesh Ambani, on February 25, 2021.

180.title: Raids on Chinese firms linked to 'spy' Luo Sang's arrest: Report
180.article_body: The crackdown on Chinese firms like Huawei and Xiaomi by enforcement agencies is linked to the arrest of Chinese national Luo Sang, who is accused of spying for China, ANI reported. The Income Tax Department had caught Sang alias Charlie Peng in raids related to a ₹1,000 crore Hawala network in 2020. Both Huawei and Xiaomi have denied the allegations.

181.title: That woman is unstable: Shatrughan Sinha's son on Pooja Mishra's 'sex scam' claim
181.article_body: Reacting to 'Bigg Boss 5' contestant Pooja Mishra's claim that Shatrughan Sinha and his family traded her in a 'sex scam', son Luv Sinha tweeted, "That woman needs professional help...She's unstable." "I normally don't waste...time responding to...trash...but I think the...editor who approved this story should realise that strong legal action can be taken," he added while tagging a media house.

182.title: Delhi reports 1,354 COVID-19 cases, 1,486 recoveries in last 24 hrs
182.article_body: Delhi reported 1,354 new COVID-19 cases and one related death in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,88,404. The national capital reported 1,486 recoveries and the active cases stand at 5,853, while the positivity rate is 7.64%. Delhi on Tuesday had reported 1,414 COVID-19 cases and one related death.

183.title: Loudspeaker issue can be fatal for national integration: Lalu Yadav
183.article_body: Former Bihar CM and RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav has said that the loudspeaker issue can be fatal for the national integration. This is equivalent to division of the nation, he added. "Why are you going towards the mosques? Hanuman Chalisa can be recited in temples. This actually aims at irritating a community," Lalu Prasad Yadav said.

184.title: Myanmar junta court rejects Suu Kyi's plea against 5-yr-jail term
184.article_body: Deposed Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi's appeal against a five-year jail sentence for graft was rejected by a junta court on Wednesday. Suu Kyi was handed the jail term last week after being found guilty of accepting a bribe of cash and gold from a former minister. Notably, she has also been charged with several other corruption cases.

185.title: Siddaramaiah demands judicial probe into alleged K'taka PSI scam
185.article_body: Congress leader and former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah demanded a judicial probe into the alleged Karnataka police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam worth ₹300 crore. "I am asking the government why they have not suspended or registered an FIR against these officers," Siddaramaiah questioned. He also demanded the dismissal of the higher education minister from the cabinet.

186.title: Have a couple more kids and enjoy love, David Warner jokingly advises Virat Kohli
186.article_body: On being asked what advice he'd give to Virat Kohli over his poor form in initial matches of IPL 2022, DC opener David Warner jokingly said, "Have a couple more kids and enjoy love." He added, "Form is temporary and class is permanent. So you don't lose that. [Bad form] happens to every single player in the world."

187.title: Another sign that pandemic isn't done with us: WHO on 2 new sub-variants of Omicron
187.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has said that the South African scientists who identified Omicron variant of COVID-19 late last year have now reported two more Omicron sub-variants, BA.4 and BA.5. "This is another sign that the [COVID-19] pandemic is not done with us, and there are some clear takeaways," WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said on Wednesday.

188.title: I'm passionately excited about Abhinav Bindra's biopic: Anil Kapoor
188.article_body: Anil Kapoor, speaking about the biopic of Olympic gold-medalist Abhinav Bindra, has said, "That's the next thing that I'm...passionately excited about." "We are...in pre-production because that film needs a lot of planning," he added. Anil's son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor will reportedly be playing Abhinav in the film. "I'm sure...Harsh is also looking forward to starting that film," Anil stated.

189.title: Odisha doubles ex-gratia for relatives of deceased jawans to ₹10 lakh
189.article_body: The Odisha government on Wednesday doubled the ex-gratia for the relatives of deceased jawans killed during wars and anti-terrorist operations from ₹5 lakh to ₹10 lakh. In February 2019, ex-gratia of ₹10 lakh was announced by CM Naveen Patnaik for the families of Central Reserve Police Force jawans, who were killed in a terror attack in J&K's Pulwama.

190.title: European style roads in Delhi will be a reality soon: Sisodia
190.article_body: Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said European style roads will soon be a reality in Delhi as he reviewed the streetscaping projects on Wednesday. This effort of the Kejriwal Government will also decongest city roads and enhance mobility along with making them beautiful, he said. He further added that the government is also developing facilities for pedestrians.

191.title: India may curb wheat exports as record heat damages crop: Report
191.article_body: India, which experienced its hottest March on record, is considering restricting wheat exports as severe heatwaves have damaged crops, Bloomberg reported. As per its source, the government might boost domestic supply by setting a minimum export price. This comes as the Food Ministry on Wednesday reduced its estimate of wheat output this season to 105 million tonnes.

192.title: Mist Cooling System installed in Odisha amid heatwave: Indian Railways
192.article_body: Mist Cooling System has been installed at a railway station in Odisha's Sambalpur to help the commuters beat the heat amid the heatwave, the Ministry of Railways tweeted. The tweet showed a video of how the cooling system works. Several states including Jharkhand, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Punjab and Karnataka have been witnessing heatwave.

193.title: Sri Lanka's economic crisis will last for at least 2 more yrs: Minister
193.article_body: Sri Lanka's Finance Minister Ali Sabry on Wednesday said that the country's ongoing economic crisis will last for at least two more years, according to a report. Sabry said, "People should know the truth...We won't be able to resolve this crisis in two years, but the actions we take today will determine how much longer this problem will drag."

194.title: PM Modi welcomed by Indian diaspora on his arrival in Paris
194.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was on Wednesday welcomed by the Indian community in Paris. PM Modi arrived in the French capital on the third and final leg of his visit to three European countries. He will meet French President Emmanuel Macron during his visit. PM Modi earlier visited Germany and Denmark.

195.title: Made me uncomfortable: Palak on being clicked with Ibrahim Ali Khan
195.article_body: Palak Tiwari, who was recently clicked with actor Saif Ali Khan's son Ibrahim Ali Khan, has said it was something new for her. "I was a little taken aback and it made me a little uncomfortable," she stated. Earlier, Palak had said she and Ibrahim are just friends and all the rumours about them being a couple are a "conjecture".

196.title: Refrain from destabilising actions: US to North Korea on missile launch
196.article_body: United States condemned North Korea's ballistic missile launch on Wednesday and urged Pyongyang to refrain from further destabilising actions, the US military said. The US, however, said that this event does not pose an immediate threat to US personnel or its allies, adding, "We'll continue to monitor the situation." The launch reportedly marks North Korea's 14th weapons test this year.

197.title: LIC IPO booked 67% on day 1; policyholder share subscribed 1.99 times
197.article_body: LIC IPO was subscribed 67% on the first day of bidding on Wednesday, with investors bidding for 10.8 crore shares, compared with the total 16.2 crore shares on offer. While the policyholders' share was subscribed 1.99 times, employees' portion was subscribed 1.17 times. "The demand seems to be quite good...RBI rate hike...will have a limited impact," an expert told Reuters.

198.title: Jacqueline replaced by Nora Fatehi in Pawan Kalyan's film: Report
198.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez has reportedly been replaced by Nora Fatehi in Actor Pawan Kalyan's Telugu film 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu'. "Because Nora is a good dancer and has impressive facial expressions, she is considered suitable for the role," a source said. Nora will reportedly be portraying the role of Roshanara Begum in the film, who was Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's sister.

199.title: Russia responsible for ties with Japan now: PM Kishida after entry ban
199.article_body: Japan PM Fumio Kishida, who has been banned along with 62 other Japanese citizens from entering Russia, said that Russia is now fully responsible for state of bilateral ties. Russia cited "unacceptable rhetoric" against Moscow as the reason for the ban. Notably, the ban came in response to Japan's sanctions against Russian President Vladimir Putin, other officials over Ukraine's invasion.

200.title: Curfew in Jodhpur imposed after clashes extended till May 6 midnight
200.article_body: The district administration in Rajasthan's Jodhpur has extended the curfew till midnight of May 6 (Friday). The curfew was imposed in 10 police station areas on Tuesday after communal clashes broke out on Monday night. Several people, including police personnel, were injured during the violence in the district.

201.title: Kim Kardashian was gifted a box containing Monroe's hair before Met Gala, reveals video
201.article_body: Kim Kardashian, who wore the custom-made Jean Louis gown that was worn by Marilyn Monroe during her performance for ex-US President John F Kennedy in 1962 at this year's Met Gala, was gifted a box containing a lock of Monroe's hair. She got the present during a dress fitting, revealed a video shared by 'Ripley's Believe It or Not!'.

202.title: 4 men drag teen girl out of auto and tear her clothes in UP, post video online
202.article_body: A teenaged girl travelling with her aunt in an auto-rickshaw was allegedly pulled out of the vehicle and molested by four youths in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda recently. They dragged her to roadside bushes where they tore her clothes and molested her and later posted the incident's video online, police said. A search has been launched to nab the accused.

203.title: Google hires ex-civil servant Archana Gulati as India policy head: Report
203.article_body: Google has hired former civil services officer Archana Gulati as its public policy head in India, Reuters reported. Gulati, a telecom and competition policy expert who retired voluntarily at Sr. DDG (Additional Secretary Level), has been a financial advisor to the government for over 30 years. Until March 2021, she worked as Joint Secretary for Digital Communications at NITI Aayog.

204.title: Musk plans to take Twitter public again 3 years after buyout: Report
204.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk, who struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion and to take it private, could take the company public again after a few years, WSJ reported. Musk reportedly told potential investors that he plans to take Twitter public in as little as three years of buying it. Twitter's IPO took place in November 2013.

205.title: India to be official country of honour at Cannes Film Market this year
205.article_body: India will be the official country of honours at the Cannes Film Market this year. It will be for the first time that a country has been honoured and the tradition will continue in the upcoming years. The event will be held from May 17 to May 25. Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur will be giving the welcome address.

206.title: Dehradun school reports 16 COVID cases, turned into micro-containment zone
206.article_body: As many as 16 people tested positive for COVID-19 at the Welham Girls' School in Uttarakhand's Dehradun. As per District Magistrate R Rajesh Kumar, six of the students tested COVID-19 positive on Tuesday and the rest over the past one week. The residential school has been declared a micro-containment zone.

207.title: 26 killed, 12 injured in road accident in Ukraine: Interior Ministry
207.article_body: Ukrainian Interior Ministry said that 26 people were killed and 12 others were injured in a road accident in the country's Rivne region on Tuesday. The accident reportedly took place after a passenger bus, a minibus and a fuel truck collided, resulting in the explosion of the fuel truck. According to the ministry, the passenger bus was heading to Poland.

208.title: BJP using Raj Thackeray to divide Hindus in Maha: Raut on loudspeaker row
208.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut has accused BJP of orchestrating loudspeaker controversy in Maharashtra and using MNS leader Raj Thackeray to create a divide among Hindus. "Now...temples also have to bear the brunt of it. It's a black day for...Hindus [who] couldn't hear 'aartis' [through loudspeakers] because of BJP's politics," he added. There are no illegal loudspeakers in Maharashtra, Raut added.

209.title: Mumbai logs 117 COVID-19 cases in last 24 hrs, highest since Feb 25
209.article_body: Mumbai on Wednesday reported 117 new coronavirus positive cases, its highest one-day tally since February 25, which took its overall count to 10,60,187, reports said. No COVID-19 related deaths were reported, while there are 642 active cases in the city. COVID-19 infections in Mumbai ran into three figures for the second consecutive day as 100 cases were reported on Tuesday.

210.title: Clear garbage or we'll dump it at Delhi BJP chief's house: AAP
210.article_body: AAP leader Durgesh Pathak on Wednesday said that garbage will be dumped outside Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta's house if the party fails to clear it from the streets of Karol Bagh. He said that BJP has left no stone unturned to litter Delhi, adding that instead of paying garbage pickers, BJP is distributing the money amongst themselves.

211.title: India excludes 1,157 products from free trade pact with UAE
211.article_body: India has excluded as many as 1,157 products, including TVs, picture tubes, soaps, toys, footwear, sharbat and petroleum waxes from the ambit of India-UAE Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA). As per the FAQs prepared by the Commerce Ministry, India won't provide any customs duty concessions on these products given the sensitivities of these products for the domestic industry.

212.title: Looking into other options to deal with EU's ban on oil imports: Russia
212.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's spokesperson Dmitry Peskov has said that they are "looking into different options" after European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen proposed a ban on all oil imports from Russia. Leyen said, "This will be...complete import ban on all Russian oil-seaborne and pipeline, crude and refined." "Putin must pay...a high price for his brutal aggression," she added.

213.title: Rahul to visit poll-bound Gujarat on May 10, will address tribals
213.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly polls, Congress' Rahul Gandhi will visit the state on May 10 and launch 'Adivasi Adhikar Satyagrah' campaign in Dahod. "Congress will reinstate the rights of tribals...Rahul will share [party's] roadmap for...development of tribals," a party leader said. This comes days after AAP's Arvind Kejriwal announced the party's alliance with Bharatiya Tribal Party in Gujarat.

214.title: This rate hike was needed: Uday Kotak on repo rate hiked to 4.40%
214.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak has said the Reserve Bank of India's decision to hike the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40% is justified. "I think this rate hike was needed and I'm glad that they have acted intra-market and intra policy," Kotak stated. He added that the bank will be transmitting the rate hike to its borrowers.

215.title: CSK's Mukesh Choudhary hits Virat Kohli in direct hit attempt, apologises immediately
215.article_body: CSK pacer Mukesh Choudhary hit Virat Kohli with the ball while attempting a direct hit during RCB's first over in their IPL 2022 match on Wednesday. Kohli played the delivery straight to Mukesh, who attempted a direct hit seeing Kohli out of crease. The ball hit Kohli as he dived to get inside the crease, following which Mukesh apologised immediately.

216.title: Agnihotri says scheduled press conference for Kashmir Files was cancelled, shares chat
216.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri claimed that Press Club of India (PCI) cancelled a scheduled press conference on 'The Kashmir Files'. "The watchdogs of democracy...not only banned me undemocratically but are also lying through their teeth," Agnihotri tweeted, sharing messages of an agency directed to book PCI. He further said the press conference will now be held at a Delhi 5-star hotel.

217.title: Farmer finds 11.88-carat diamond worth around ₹50 lakh in MP mine
217.article_body: A small-time farmer in Madhya Pradesh's Panna district has found an 11.88-carat diamond in a mine. As per private estimates, the diamond may fetch over ₹50 lakh at an auction. The money received from the auction will be used for setting up a business and for the education of the farmer's children.

218.title: Royal Bengal Tiger attacks animal keeper at Chennai's Vandalur Zoo
218.article_body: An animal keeper at Chennai's Vandalur Zoo sustained minor injuries after he was attacked by a Royal Bengal Tiger. The animal keeper, identified as Chellaiya, has been with the wildlife sanctuary for more than three decades now, officials said. "The tiger was not keeping well...The caretaker...was present alongside the veterinary team so nothing major happened," the zoo director said.

219.title: Investors lose ₹6.27 lakh crore as Sensex crashes 1,300 points after repo rate hike
219.article_body: Investors lost ₹6.27 lakh crore on Wednesday after the Sensex ended 1,306 points lower, at 55,669, after the RBI announced a 40 bps hike in repo rate to 4.40%. The broader NSE Nifty tanked 392 points to finish at 16,678. Bajaj Finance was the biggest loser in the Sensex pack, followed by Bajaj Finserv, Titan, IndusInd Bank and HDFC Bank.

220.title: Which cricketers have played the most matches for a single franchise in IPL?
220.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni on Wednesday became the second player after RCB's Virat Kohli to play 200 matches for a single franchise in IPL. Kohli is playing his 218th IPL match for RCB today, the most IPL matches by a player for a single franchise. Kohli and Dhoni are followed by Kieron Pollard (187, MI) and Rohit Sharma (177, MI).

221.title: Rohit, Tiger to invest 4-5 months to prepare for 'Rambo': Report
221.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Dhawan and actor Tiger Shroff will reportedly be investing four to five months to prepare for their upcoming film 'Rambo'. "Rohit will start working on it after he wraps up...'Shehzada' with Kartik Aaryan and Kriti Sanon," a source told Pinkvilla. "While Tiger will train for the larger-than-life action sequences, Rohit will begin the pre-production formalities," the source added.

222.title: Chennai man beaten to death by de-addiction centre workers, 7 held
222.article_body: Chennai Police said that a 48-year-old man was beaten to death by workers at a de-addiction centre and seven people were arrested in the case. The police found out that the deceased, M Raj, who was addicted to alcohol, had created a ruckus at the de-addiction centre and was beaten up by facility workers with sticks and other items.

223.title: Mother of two raped by a 20-year-old in Andhra's Vizianagaram
223.article_body: A 26-year-old woman, a mother of two children, was raped by a 20-year-old man at her residence in Andhra Pradesh's Vizianagaram. Police said that the victim had separated from her husband and was staying in a rented house in Vizianagaram with her children. Deepika Patil, Vizianagaram Superintendent of Police, said that the accused was taken into custody.

224.title: Pics show gifts PM Modi gave to leaders of 5 nations he met in Denmark
224.article_body: After meeting leaders of Nordic countries, PM Narendra Modi gifted Rogan Painting from Gujarat to Denmark Queen Margrethe II. He gifted a Pashmina stole in Papier Mache box from J&K to Sweden PM Magdalena Andersson and a Brass Tree of Life from Rajasthan to Finland PM Sanna Marin. He gifted Dokra boat from Chhattisgarh to Crown Prince Frederik of Denmark.

225.title: AAP's Raghav Chadha, Atishi booked for 'defamatory remarks' against BJP
225.article_body: The Delhi Police have named AAP MP Raghav Chadha and MLA Atishi in a non-cognizable report for their alleged defamatory remarks against BJP and its workers. "Atishi and...Raghav Chadha referred to BJP workers as criminals, hooligans, rapists during press conferences on April 15 and 16," the report, which was registered based on BJP IT cell chief Abhishek Dubey's complaint, noted.

226.title: DRG jawan martyred in encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh
226.article_body: Police said that a District Reserve Guard (DRG) head constable was killed in an encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur district. The encounter took place around 8.15 am on Wednesday at a forest in Tulargufa-Mungari area, IGP Sundarraj P said. A joint team of various security forces was out on a search operation when the encounter took place, he added.

227.title: Culprits involved in riots will not be spared: Rajasthan CM
227.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said the culprits involved in riots will not be spared and added that the government was taking steps to ensure no violence takes place in Rajasthan. "No one has the right to take law and order in their hands," he added. His comment comes after communal clashes in Jodhpur on Tuesday.

228.title: NHRC issues notice to UP Chief Secy, DGP over gang-rape of 13-yr-old
228.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission on Wednesday issued notices to the Chief Secretary and Director General of UP Police and sought a report within four weeks over the alleged gang-rape of a 13-year-old. Stating that it had taken suo motu cognisance of media reports of the case, the Commission said the content amounted to human rights violation of the victim.

229.title: EU promises more military aid for Moldova amid Ukraine crisis
229.article_body: European Union (EU) pledged more military assistance for Ukraine's neighbouring country Moldova on Wednesday amid the former's invasion. European Council President Charles Michel said that EU will step up aid for Moldova in the "field of logistics [and] cyber defence". The move comes amid reports of unrest in Moldova's breakaway region of Transnistria, which is controlled by pro-Russian forces.

230.title: Filmmaker Rohit Dhawan, wife Jaanvi blessed with a baby boy
230.article_body: Rohit Dhawan and his wife Jaanvi Dhawan welcomed a baby boy. This is their second child together after the birth of their daughter Niyara in 2018. A media account shared a video of Rohit and his father David Dhawan stepping out of PD Hinduja Hospital in Mumbai. Rohit made his directorial debut with Akshay Kumar and John Abraham-starrer 'Desi Boyz'.

231.title: Pfizer opens Asia's 1st global drug development centre in Chennai
231.article_body: US pharmaceutical company Pfizer on Wednesday launched a global drug research and development centre at the IIT Madras Research Park in Chennai at an initial investment of ₹150 crore. The 61,000-square-foot facility is among 12 centres established worldwide and the first in Asia. It employs 250 scientists and technicians, and would develop and support products in global markets, Pfizer said.

232.title: India's services exports set new record of $254.4 billion in FY22
232.article_body: Commerce Ministry on Wednesday said India's services exports set a new record of $254.4 billion (over ₹19 lakh crore) in FY22. It added that services exports also hit an all-time monthly high of $26.9 billion in March 2022. The top contributors to the exports were transport, telecommunications and computer and information services, the Ministry added.

233.title: Man crashes ₹5 crore Ford GT supercar just days after buying it in US
233.article_body: A 50-year-old man crashed his Ford GT car into a tree just days after buying it for $704,000 (over ₹5 crore) at a US auction. Police report said that the crash was caused by inexperience with a manual transmission. The driver claimed that old tires, muddy pavement and fresh detailing caused the car to swing out and hit a tree.

234.title: PM Modi's pic in Germany from 1993 surfaces amid his Europe tour
234.article_body: An old picture of PM Narendra Modi in Germany has surfaced on social media amid his Europe tour. It shows a young PM Modi, when he was a BJP worker, and one of his colleagues standing before statue of Charlemagne. It was reportedly taken in 1993 in Frankfurt, where he had a brief halt while returning to India from US.

235.title: I focus on my work: Kartik Aaryan on Dharma Productions controversy
235.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has opened up about his controversy with Karan Johar's Dharma Productions after the actor was no longer a part of 'Dostana 2'. "I just focus on my work. That's all I would like to say about this," Kartik stated. "What happens...is people make a mountain out of a molehill. There's nothing more to it," he added.

236.title: Congress cell's lawyers yell at Chidambaram, show him black robes at Calcutta HC
236.article_body: Senior Congress leader and advocate P Chidambaram faced protest by lawyers of Congress' legal cell at Calcutta High Court. The video of the incident shows the lawyers showing him black robes and shouting slogans, saying he's a TMC sympathiser and responsible for Congress' poor show in West Bengal. Chidambaram was reportedly representing a company sued by Congress' Adhir Chowdhury.

237.title: Putin miscalculated his brutal invasion of Ukraine: Chancellor Scholz
237.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Wednesday said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "completely miscalculated with his brutal invasion of Ukraine". Scholz said that Putin is now facing "a stronger NATO" and "a unified European Union". His remarks came after a two-day closed-door German Cabinet meeting on the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war and its impact on the German economy ended today.

238.title: Baseball signed by Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy to be sold for war relief aid
238.article_body: A baseball signed by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is being auctioned in US to raise funds for Ukraine amid its ongoing invasion. The leading bid for the baseball as of Tuesday had exceeded $15,000 (over ₹11 lakh), the auctioneer confirmed. Zelenskyy had signed the ball in 2019 for an American collector, Randy Kaplan, who collects baseballs signed by world leaders.

239.title: Mumbai man's edited obscene pic leaked after he fails to repay loan
239.article_body: Mumbai police have registered an FIR against unknown persons for circulating a morphed obscene photo of a 23-year-old man after he failed to repay loans worth ₹6,000. The complainant said that he took the loans from two mobile applications. He added that six members of his family and locality had received the photo, which came from five different numbers.

240.title: CSK to bowl first against RCB, Dhoni featuring in his 200th IPL match for CSK
240.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni won the toss and elected to bowl first against RCB in their IPL 2022 match on Wednesday. Dhoni is playing his 200th IPL match for CSK. CSK have made one change to their playing XI, with Moeen Ali replacing Mitchell Santner. Meanwhile, RCB are fielding an unchanged side.

241.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan calls for early polls under ‘neutral’ authority
241.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Tuesday called for expedited general elections, adding that it should be held under supervision of a "neutral" chief election commissioner. Khan, who was ousted from power via a no-trust vote in parliament last month, stated that new government has been imposed on people. PML-N leader Shehbaz Sharif took oath as Pakistan PM on April 11.

242.title: Policeman who raped 13-yr-old rape survivor in UP police station arrested
242.article_body: The Station House Officer (SHO), who allegedly raped a 13-year-old rape survivor when she had gone to the police station to file a complaint in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur, has been arrested from Prayagraj. The police officer was absconding. Earlier, the SHO was suspended and all policemen of the police station in Lalitpur were sent to police lines.

243.title: Ukraine war set to worsen severe hunger worldwide: UN report
243.article_body: UN's Global Network Against Food Crises said that Russia's invasion of Ukraine poses serious risks to global food security. In a report, it said the number of people facing acute food insecurity and requiring urgent life-saving food assistance has nearly doubled since 2016. "If more isn't done to support rural communities...scale of...devastation in terms of hunger...will be appalling," it added.

244.title: 78% of Indian organisations hit by ransomware in 2021: Survey
244.article_body: As many as 78% of Indian organisations were hit with ransomware in 2021, up from 68% in 2020, a survey by security vendor Sophos claimed. It said the average ransom paid by Indian organisations that had their data encrypted in most significant ransomware attacks was $1.2 million. Some 10% of victims payed ransoms of $1 million or more, it added.

245.title: Adani's Mumbai International Airport raises $750 mn from Apollo
245.article_body: Adani Enterprises said its subsidiary Mumbai International Airport Ltd (MIAL), which runs the Mumbai airport, has raised $750 million senior secured private placement notes from Apollo-managed credit funds. The proceeds will be used to refinance existing shorter maturity loans and new capital expenditure, it added. In March, Adani Enterprises concluded financing of its Navi Mumbai airport.

246.title: Ahan Shetty reacts to Athiya Shetty & KL Rahul's wedding reports
246.article_body: Reacting to reports of his sister Athiya Shetty and cricketer KL Rahul's wedding, Ahan Shetty said, "There's no such ceremony, these are all rumours." He added, "When there's no wedding, how can we give you a date?" Ahan said that the duo have not even been engaged and stated, "There's no planning for a wedding in the next few months."

247.title: Negative comments do affect me, I'm not an android: Elon Musk
247.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk, while speaking on Met Gala's red carpet, said that he's not immune to the negative comments made about him. "Well, it does get to me sometimes, I mean...I do have feelings. I'm not an android," he stated. He, however, added that he tries to "take these things with a grain of salt".

248.title: Loudspeakers removed peacefully from mosques in UP: Dy CM Maurya
248.article_body: UP Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya said on Wednesday that the peaceful manner in which loudspeakers are being removed from religious places in state "is an example for the entire country". "Opposition always makes provocative remarks but...law and order in UP is [fine]," he added. Nearly 54,000 loudspeakers were removed from religious places in UP till May 1.

249.title: 91% of 11 lakh people in Delhi believe BJP orchestrates riots: AAP
249.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party claimed that 91% of the 11.5 lakh respondents to its survey in Delhi believe that BJP orchestrates riots. Responding to the second question, which was about the party having the highest number of goons, 89% of people said it's BJP, 5% believed it's Congress and 2% said it's AAP, according to Deputy CM of Delhi Manish Sisodia.

250.title: Civic authorities asked to raze down illegal structures in Thane
250.article_body: Senior civic officials of the Kalyan Dombivli Municipal Corporation (KDMC) in Maharashtra's Thane have been asked to take action against illegal structures and encroachments, officials said. KDMC commissioner Dr Vijay Suryavanshi said land sharks encroached on civic utility lands and carried out construction work, the official added. He directed officials to identify such properties and raze them.

251.title: I like being different: World's tallest living woman who holds 4 world records
251.article_body: Turkey's Rumeysa Gelgi, the tallest living woman at 7-feet-0.7-inch height with four Guinness World Records, said, "I like being different from everyone else." She also holds records for the longest finger on a living person (female), the largest hands on a living person (female) and the longest back on a living person (female). Her height is due to Weaver syndrome.

252.title: NATO barking at Russia's door may have facilitated Ukraine's invasion: Pope Francis
252.article_body: Pope Francis said that NATO "barking" at Russia's door may have led to Russian President Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine. "I wouldn't know if this provoked an ire but perhaps it facilitated it," he stated. Asked about a trip to the Ukrainian capital Kyiv, the Pope said, "First, I've to go to Moscow, first I have to meet Putin."

253.title: AAP workers protest against corruption in KPSC in B'luru, detained
253.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) workers protested against Karnataka Public Service Commission (KPSC) in Bengaluru over alleged corruption after which the workers were detained by the police. The protest was led by AAP's Bengaluru President Mohan Dasari. "People who appear for KPSC are not seeing any hopes. Every year one or the other scam emerges in KPSC," he said.

254.title: Booking MP Navneet, MLA Ravi Rana for sedition was stupidity: Fadnavis
254.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday said Mumbai Police's decision to book Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana for sedition was stupidity. "There can not be anything more stupid than arresting someone for reciting the Hanuman Chalisa. This was foolishness of the government and the grant of bail establishes that," Fadnavis said.

255.title: People in Hyd take out boats as rain brings relief & waterlogging
255.article_body: People in Hyderabad used rubber boats after heavy rains lashed parts of the city on Wednesday morning causing waterlogging in many areas. A PTI report said waterlogging and inundation were seen in several localities of Hyderabad, including Amberpet, Kukatpally, Malkajgiri and Musheerabad and the old city. Thundershowers are likely to occur in parts of Telangana, IMD said.

256.title: Tamil Nadu administration bans Mutt's palanquin ritual; devotees protest
256.article_body: Tamil Nadu administration denied permission for 'Pattina Pravesam' ritual in Mayiladuthurai in which devotees carry the Dharmapuram mutt's seer on a silver palanquin. A group of devotees held a protest against the government's decision ahead of the ritual scheduled for May 22. State BJP chief K Annamalai said he would lift the palanquin himself if authorities didn't allow the ritual.

257.title: PM Modi meets leaders of 5 countries in Denmark, pic released
257.article_body: PM Narendra Modi met leaders of Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden on Wednesday for the second India-Nordic Summit in Copenhagen. Releasing the picture of the leaders, External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson said, "The 2018 Summit in Stockholm was the 1st time India engaged with the Nordic countries as a group on a single platform."

258.title: PM adopted policy of 'All rank, No pension'; insult to nation: Rahul
258.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday accused PM Narendra Modi of adopting the 'All Rank, No Pension' policy after the scam of the 'One Rank, One Pension' policy. He also accused PM of insulting the nation by not giving pensions to hundreds of servicemen, including three-star officers. The government should give pensions to former servicemen at the earliest, he said.

259.title: Pune Police look for man who sought ₹7cr for ‘bomb threat’ information
259.article_body: Pune Police have launched search to track a man who made hoax call on Tuesday regarding 'bomb threat' at a railway station. The accused, who dialed emergency helpline number 112, sought ₹7 crore from authorities to reveal the location. "As we launched a probe into...call, we also mobilised...Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad and other quick response teams," an official said.

260.title: Biggest kept secret: Benedict on if Cruise appears in Doctor Strange 2
260.article_body: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch has reacted to the rumours of actor Tom Cruise being part of his film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. "Tom? Yeah, he's in every scene you haven't seen in the trailer. It's the biggest kept secret," Benedict said. Speaking about fan theories, he said, "I try not to react or go to the internet."

261.title: Vibrant independent press a cornerstone for healthy democracy: Blinken
261.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Tuesday said that a vibrant independent press is a cornerstone for any healthy democracy. He further said that exercise of freedom of the press is facing profound threats in the current time. "Governments are supplementing traditional forms of repression with new tactics aimed at undermining press freedom," he added.

262.title: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' faces legal action over sex-determination scene
262.article_body: Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' is facing legal action in Delhi High Court over the prenatal sex determination scene in the trailer. According to Live Law, advocate Pawan Prakash Pathak's plea stated that the practice of prenatal sex determination as shown in the trailer is prohibited. In the plea, Pawan asked for the scene to be deleted for promoting prohibited activities.

263.title: PM Modi meets Finland PM, discusses ways to deepen bilateral ties
263.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday met Finland PM Sanna Marin during his Europe tour and discussed ways to further deepen bilateral ties. "There is immense potential in expanding the India-Finland digital partnership, trade partnership and investment linkages," PM Modi said. He also held a series of bilateral meetings with his counterparts from Norway, Sweden and Iceland.

264.title: Sundar Pichai fact-checks his Wikipedia page edits, says 'I wasn't homeschooled'
264.article_body: Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai during a recent interview fact-checked edits made by people on the Wikipedia page about him. On an edit claiming he was homeschooled, Pichai clarified, "I wasn't homeschooled." On edits naming several Indian schools that Pichai studied at, he clarified, "Two schools are right...the final school is 'Vana Vani', situated in the IIT Madras campus."

265.title: LIC IPO subscribed 63% on Day 1; staff, policyholder portions fully subscribed
265.article_body: India's biggest-ever IPO of LIC was subscribed 63% till 5:06 pm on the first day of bidding on Wednesday. The LIC policyholders led the initial bout of buying in LIC's IPO as they subscribed 1.84 times the portion reserved for them. The employee reserved portion has subscribed 104% while the retail investors' portion has been subscribed 56%, Moneycontrol reported.

266.title: Pic shows strong solar flare erupting from Sun, NASA highlights its impact on Earth
266.article_body: The Sun emitted a strong solar flare on April 30, an image of which has been shared by NASA. It can be seen in the bright flash in the picture's upper right portion. Solar flares are sudden releases of magnetic energy, which if directed towards Earth, can impact radio communications, electric power grids and pose risks to spacecraft and astronauts.

267.title: Rahul never spoke for T'gana, his visit to state is political: TRS MLC
267.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha on Wednesday termed Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's upcoming visit to Telangana 'politically motivated', adding that he'd never spoken for the state's welfare. "During...paddy crop issue, we urged him (Rahul Gandhi) to raise the issue in Parliament..but he did not," she said. Her remarks come days after Gandhi was denied permission to visit Hyderabad's Osmania University.

268.title: EU proposes Russian oil ban to make Putin 'pay high price' for Ukraine
268.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen has proposed a ban on all oil imports from Russia by year-end to make President Vladimir Putin pay a "high price for his brutal aggression" in Ukraine. The ban would be part of EU's sixth package of sanctions against Russia. The proposal requires approval from all 27 member countries to come into effect.

269.title: RCB's NRR is so bad that only points can take them through: Shaun Pollock
269.article_body: Ex-MI all-rounder Shaun Pollock said RCB's net run-rate (NRR) in IPL 2022 so far is "so bad" that only points can take them through. "You don't see them squeaking through after being level on points. It is all about winning," added Pollock. Talking about CSK who will face RCB today, Pollock stated that CSK cannot afford to make a mistake.

270.title: B'luru Traffic Police creates green corridor for live heart transportation
270.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Wednesday created a green corridor for transporting a live heart to a hospital in the city and also shared a video of the same on Twitter. The corridor to carry the live heart was created between Manipal Hospital in Hebbal to MS Ramaiah Memorial Hospital. Police also provided a green corridor for transportation of liver today.

271.title: Extreme Muslim appeasement: BJP to KCR on allowing to write Group I exams in Urdu
271.article_body: The BJP criticised the Telangana government over its decision of giving option to write exams for Group I posts in Urdu language and said that CM K Chandrashekar Rao was indulging in politics of appeasement for his vote bank. "This is extreme Muslim appeasement...The exam written in Urdu can only be corrected by a Muslim," BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri said.

272.title: Man takes off 2 girls' clothes, urinates in Delhi school; principal tells girls 'forget it'
272.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal has issued a notice to police after a man allegedly entered a municipal school in Delhi and sexually assaulted two girls. She said the man took off the girls' clothes and urinated in front of an entire class. "When the girls told the principal & teacher, they said 'forget about it'," Maliwal added.

273.title: My 1st shot ever was an action sequence: Akshay on 30 yrs in B'wood
273.article_body: After completing 30 years in Indian cinema, actor Akshay Kumar recalled the first-ever shot of his filming career. In a video clip released by YRF's Twitter handle, Akshay can be heard saying, "Pehla shot action ka diya tha Ooty mein (My first shot ever was an action sequence in Ooty)." The actor made his Bollywood debut with 'Saugandh' in 1991.

274.title: Announce dates of BMC elections within 2 weeks: SC tells Maha govt
274.article_body: The Supreme Court has ordered the Uddhav Thackeray-led Maharashtra government to declare schedule for the pending BMC elections within two weeks. The apex court also said that the matter of OBC reservation in the election will be heard later. Earlier, the state government had said that BMC elections will be held only after OBC reservation in the elections was approved.

275.title: Hyd police advises people to drive safe amid rainfall, waterlogging
275.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police alerted people to drive safe amid rainfall in the city on Wednesday. The traffic police also shared a video of a waterlogged road in the city and wrote, "It's raining. Please drive carefully." Waterlogging was seen in several localities, including Amberpet, Kukatpally, Malkajgiri, Musheerabad and the old city.

276.title: No masks or COVID-19 tests needed to attend Cannes: General secretary
276.article_body: Cannes general secretary Francois Desrousseaux has said that guests attending the 2022 event will not have to show proof of testing or vaccination. "Most participants will likely be vaccinated anyway because France has made it very complicated for non-vaccinated travellers to enter the country," Francois added. He said masks will no longer be mandatory indoors, however, are strongly recommended.

277.title: Russia warns it'll target transport carrying NATO weapons in Ukraine
277.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu on Wednesday accused the US and its NATO allies of "continuing to pump weapons into Ukraine".  "We view any transport of...NATO arriving on the territory of the country with weapons or materials destined to the Ukrainian army as a target to be destroyed," Shoigu warned on day 70 of Russia's 'special military operation' in Ukraine.

278.title: EU chief proposes phased ban on all Russian oil imports
278.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday proposed a phased oil embargo on Russia, sanctions on its top bank and a ban on Russian broadcasters from European airwaves. "Today, we will propose to ban all Russian oil from Europe. This will be a complete import ban on all Russian oil-seaborne and pipeline, crude and refined," Leyen said.

279.title: Time will reply: Sidhu after disciplinary action sought against him
279.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Wednesday shared a tweet, days after Punjab Congress in-charge Harish Chaudhary sought disciplinary action against him. "I often listen in silence to conversations against me...I have given...right to reply to time," Sidhu tweeted in Hindi. Chaudhary wrote a letter to Sonia Gandhi seeking action against Sidhu for trying to "portray himself above the party".

280.title: Vendor refuses to give free bhelpuri to drunk man in Gurugram, killed
280.article_body: A drunk man allegedly killed a 40-year-old street vendor in Gurugram after he refused to serve him bhelpuri for free, police said on Tuesday. The incident took place on Monday when Ram was on his way home with his wife, who alleged that a half-naked man hurled a stone at her husband, which hit the back of his head.

281.title: 3 Char Dham pilgrims die of heart attacks on way to Yamunotri
281.article_body: Three elderly pilgrims, including a woman, died of heart attacks on way to Yamunotri on Tuesday, the opening day of the Char Dham Yatra. The district's Disaster Management Officer, Devendra Patwal, said that all the deaths occurred at different spots along the trek route from Jankichatti to the Himalayan temple. All the three deceased persons were aged above 60 years.

282.title: RBI Governor warns of inflation, higher edible oil prices
282.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has warned that edible oil prices may go further up despite the central bank hiking the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40%. He said it was due to export restrictions by key producing countries and the loss of sunflower oil output amid Russia-Ukraine war. "Looking ahead, food inflation pressures are likely to continue," he stated.

283.title: Mumbai Police shares Blake Lively's Met Gala pics in password awareness post
283.article_body: Mumbai Police took to Instagram to share pictures of actress Blake Lively to make a reference about her dress transformation at Met Gala 2022. "Keep your passwords 'Lively'. Change them frequently," Mumbai Police wrote. Lively had worn a red-toned gown with a large bow. The actress' bow was later untied and unveiled the blue part of the gown.

284.title: I try to find out where they've come from: MI's Zaheer on working with youngsters
284.article_body: Opening up on his role as MI's Director of Cricket Operations, ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan said he helps players with the technical and mental aspects of the game. "It's important to get to know each other. So, I always try and find out where they have come from...anyone should be comfortable coming up and having conversations," he stated.

285.title: Rahul seen with those who challenge India's territorial integrity: BJP
285.article_body: A day after a video of Rahul Gandhi partying at a nightclub in Nepal surfaced online, BJP leader Amit Malviya asked why he's only seen with those who challenge India's territorial integrity. "Rahul Gandhi was supposedly at the wedding of Sumnima Udas, a Nepali diplomat's daughter, who actively supports Nepal's claims over regions of India's Uttarakhand," Malviya tweeted.

286.title: Zomato shares hit record low of ₹64, fall over 7% on Wednesday
286.article_body: Shares of food delivery giant Zomato hit a new record low of ₹64 as they fell 7.13% to close at ₹64.5 on Wednesday. Zomato has wiped out over half of its investors' wealth since January 3, when its stock price hit a high of ₹142.45. Zomato had launched its IPO in July 2021 with a price band of ₹72-76.

287.title: Need your wishes: Bhuvan Bam on making OTT debut with Taaza Khabar
287.article_body: YouTuber Bhuvan Bam announced his OTT debut on Wednesday. Sharing two pictures on Instagram, Bhuvan revealed the title of the project, 'Taaza Khabar'. Alongside the post, he wrote, "Need your wishes for my OTT debut. Your constant support has been a boon for me. New stuff this year." In the first picture, Bhuvan is seen holding Taaza Khabar's script.

288.title: He would've got 80-90 in 50 balls at his peak: Ojha on Kohli's 58 (53) vs GT
288.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's 53-ball 58 in RCB's defeat against GT by six wickets, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said, "Had he played 50 balls at his peak, he would have been on 80-90." "[I] want Kohli to play a bit more aggressively," added Ojha. Kohli has scored 186 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 116.25.

289.title: Britons buying less meat and fish, struggling to pay bills: Report
289.article_body: The Britons are buying less meat, fish and poultry owing to the rise in cost of living, market research firm NielsenIQ has said. The volume sales of those items decreased by 13% year-on-year in the four weeks leading to April 23. According to official data revealed last week, nearly one-fourth of the citizens were struggling to pay their household bills.

290.title: Beijing partly shuts down public transport to control COVID-19 spread
290.article_body: Beijing on Wednesday closed 40 subway stations and around 150 bus routes to restrict movement in a bid to curb the spread of COVID-19. The move comes days after the city barred dine-in services at restaurants and suspended in-person classes in schools till May 11. Additionally, city residents are required to undergo three COVID-19 tests throughout the week.

291.title: Couple killed, several injured as truck hits bus carrying pilgrims in UP
291.article_body: An elderly couple died while several others were injured after a bus carrying pilgrims was hit by a container truck in UP's Etawah on Wednesday. According to the Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP), 50 passengers were on the bus when it met with an accident on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway. Ten injured people were admitted to hospital, the officer added.

292.title: Delhi govt announces free bus travel for construction workers
292.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party-led Delhi government announced that they will make travel free for construction labourers working in the national capital. "All construction labourers earlier had to spend somewhere between ₹1000 to ₹3000 per month for travelling," Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. "This (step) will benefit about 10 lakh labourers in the state," he added.

293.title: Comedian Dave Chappelle attacked on stage, Chris Rock jokes 'Was that Will Smith?'
293.article_body: Comedian Dave Chappelle was attacked on stage while performing at an event in Los Angeles, according to reports at the scene. As per ABC journalist Stephanie Wash's tweet, Chris Rock, who performed earlier, came on stage and joked, "Was that Will Smith?" Chris was slapped by Smith on stage at Oscars this year.

294.title: How will the RBI's repo rate hike affect loan EMIs and FD rates?
294.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday announced that the repo rate has been increased by 40 bps to 4.40% with immediate effect. This can lead to banks hiking EMI rates of home, auto or personal loans. The repo rate hike can however mean better returns for FD (Fixed Deposit) investors on new FDs.

295.title: Have emergency backup plan in case of power outage: Delhi Metro
295.article_body: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) Managing Director Vikas Kumar on Tuesday said that DMRC is not facing any power crisis currently and has backup plans for any emergency. "DMRC receives 99 MW of electricity...through its off-site solar plant and generates 50 MW from the rooftop solar plants," Kumar said. "We are only 50% dependent on discoms," he added.

296.title: BMRCL spares over 100 trees and 152-yr-old church with revised station plan
296.article_body: The Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has decided to spare over 100 trees and the 152-year-old All Saints' Church on Hosur Road as it revised the underground metro station plan. The decision to revise the plan comes after the church group, along with some NGOs and groups, complained to European Investment Bank (EIB), which was funding the metro construction.

297.title: 2 surprises cancelling each other out: Du Plessis on CSK captaincy change
297.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja handing back CSK captaincy to MS Dhoni, RCB captain Faf du Plessis said, "I'm surprised [it] happened mid-IPL 2022." He added, "But I was also surprised at the way it happened...before the season. So, it's like two surprises cancelling each other out." Du Plessis further said, "Obviously...there's no secret...when MS is there, he is the captain."

298.title: 'I have had my share of disappointments': RBI Governor quotes Mahatma Gandhi
298.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, who on Wednesday announced the repo rate is being hiked by 40 bps to 4.40%, quoted Mahatma Gandhi during his address. "As Mahatma Gandhi said: "I have had my share of disappointments, uttermost darkness, but I am able to say that my faith has ultimately conquered every one of these difficulties"," Das said during his address.

299.title: B'wood can be unforgiving if you aren't from film background: Pooja
299.article_body: Speaking about her sporadic Hindi film career, actress Pooja Hegde said that it was a conscious decision to not do many Hindi films. "I've been offered films opposite big stars but those characters didn't add any value to the script," she added. "[Bollywood] can be...unforgiving if you aren't from...film background...it takes...time to get the...roles...you want to do," she said.

300.title: Tanzanian national held in Hyderabad with heroin worth ₹11.53 crore
300.article_body: The Air Intelligence Unit (AIU) on Tuesday arrested a Tanzanian national from Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport and seized 1389.1 gram of heroin worth ₹11.53 crore. According to officials, 108 capsules containing heroin, wrapped in an adhesive transparent tape were recovered from him. "During...investigation, it was revealed that he swallowed the capsules in Tanzania," officials said.

301.title: Need to protect women's right to choose: Biden on abortion draft
301.article_body: Amid reports of a leaked Supreme Court draft that would challenge a landmark abortion rights ruling, US President Joe Biden said it would threaten basic rights like access to birth control and marriage. He said if the ruling is overturned, elected officials will have to "protect a woman's right to choose". Voters will have to elect pro-choice officials, he added.

302.title: Russia bans Japanese PM, other top officials from entering the country
302.article_body: Russia on Wednesday banned 63 Japanese citizens from entering the country "indefinitely" for engaging in "unacceptable rhetoric" against Moscow. Those barred from entering Russia include Japanese PM Fumio Kishida, Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi, Defence Minister Nobuo Kishi and other officials, professors, and journalists. Japan has imposed sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine.

303.title: Which are the five biggest sixes of IPL 2022 so far?
303.article_body: PBKS' Liam Livingstone smashed the biggest six of IPL 2022, covering a distance of 117 metres against GT's Mohammad Shami. The second-biggest six was hit by MI's Dewald Brevis (112 metres) against PBKS' Rahul Chahar. Livingstone has also hit the third-biggest (108 metres) and the fifth-biggest six (106 metres). The fourth-biggest six (107 metres) was hit by RR's Jos Buttler.

304.title: Mandira turns off comments post getting trolled for sharing pool pics with friend
304.article_body: Actress Mandira Bedi recently took to Instagram to share a few pool pictures with her friend on his birthday. Sharing the photos, she wrote "Happy Birthday...This photograph says it all. What you mean to me...and how much I trust you." As soon as she shared the pictures, several users trolled her. Later, Mandira turned off the comments on her post.

305.title: CSK know how to make a comeback: Sunil Gavaskar
305.article_body: Ahead of CSK's game against RCB on Wednesday, former India captain Sunil Gavaskar said CSK know how to make a comeback. Gavaskar added that things turn around in a jiffy in IPL and no team can afford to take the others lightly. Currently, CSK are ninth on the IPL points table with only three wins from nine games so far.

306.title: Playing Hanuman Chalisa not a one-day affair, it will continue: Raj Thackeray
306.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray said that playing Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques is not a one-day affair, it will go on until the government addresses the situation according to what the Supreme Court has said about loudspeakers. Out of 1,140 mosques in Mumbai, 135 mosques violated the guidelines, Thackeray said. What action will be taken against these mosques, he asked police.

307.title: Hit emotional breakdown; thought marriage will fix problems : Justin Bieber
307.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber said that when he first got married, he got a bit of an emotional breakdown. "I thought marriage was going to fix all my problems and it didn't. It just kind of was a reflection of like, man, you're a bit of a hypocrite man," he said, adding that religion has played important part in his life.

308.title: Hyderabad Police chief celebrates Eid with children, pics surface
308.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand celebrated Eid with children at Eidgah near Miralam while reviewing security arrangements on Tuesday. Pictures shared by the city police show the officer interacting with people on the occasion. The city Police Commissioner also distributed sweets among those present there.

309.title: Murray defeats Shapovalov to set clash against Djokovic in Madrid Open
309.article_body: Ex-world number one Andy Murray defeated Denis Shapovalov 6-1, 3-6, 6-2 to reach the third round at the Madrid Open 2022. Murray will now face Novak Djokovic in their first match since the Qatar Open final in 2017. "I haven't had that opportunity to play against Djokovic for a long time...so I'll enjoy it...give it my best," said Murray.

310.title: 54-yr-old man, his 2 grandchildren die as jeep overturns in Rajasthan
310.article_body: A 54-year-old man and his 2 grandchildren were killed as the jeep they were travelling in overturned in Rajasthan's Bikaner on Wednesday, police said. "Members of a family, including several children...were going to Bikaner city to purchase clothes for two weddings scheduled in the family on Thursday and Friday," police added. Around 13 more people were injured, police further said.

311.title: Punjab government transfers 43 IAS, 38 PCS officers
311.article_body: CM Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government on Wednesday transferred 43 IAS and 38 PCS officers and also gave additional charges to some officers. Senior IAS officer Sarvjit Singh, who is the Additional Chief Secretary (Agriculture), has been given additional charge of soil and water conservation. Meanwhile, IAS officer Bhupinder Singh has been appointed as Special Secretary, Health and Family Welfare.

312.title: 2 Hindu sisters donate 20,400 sq ft land for Eidgah in Uttarakhand
312.article_body: Two elderly sisters named Saroj Rastogi and Anita Rastogi have donated around 20,400 sq ft of land for an Eidgah in Uttarakhand. The land has been donated to fulfil the wish of their late father. "It's a great act in such an atmosphere when our country is reeling under communal frenzy," the head of the Kashipur area's Eidgah committee said.

313.title: First time a song had such a big launch: Kartik on 'Bhool...2' title track
313.article_body: Discussing the title track of his upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', actor Kartik Aaryan said, "It is for the first time that a song had such a massive launch where we covered four cities in a day." "The kind of response we...got, it has truly surpassed all our expectations," added Kartik. "I am elated seeing the reaction," stated Kartik.

314.title: Religious festivals have become weapon for communal politics: Brinda Karat
314.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Brinda Karat said it is a matter of concern that religious festivals have become a weapon for communal politics in the country. Her remarks came following the communal clashes that took in place Rajasthan's Jodhpur. "The forces which are trying to spread unrest are succeeding in their agenda," she added.

315.title: Rain & hailstorm lash parts of Delhi amid heatwave; video surfaces
315.article_body: A hailstorm accompanied by rainfall was witnessed in parts of Delhi on Wednesday amid heatwave in parts of the country. A video has surfaced on social media showing hailstorm in the city. The IMD had issued a yellow alert and warned of a dust storm, thunderstorm or hailstorm with winds gusting up to 50 kilometres per hour in the city.

316.title: IIT Madras makes computer science courses available to the public
316.article_body: IIT Madras has made its Computer Science courses like Programming and Data Structures, Advanced Data Structures and Algorithms and Foundations of Computer System Design among others available to the general public. These courses have YouTube recordings of live lectures from the university and can be accessed by educational institutions, students or anybody else on their official website.

317.title: Journalist Boria Majumdar banned by BCCI for 2 years for bullying, threatening Saha
317.article_body: Journalist Boria Majumdar has been banned by the BCCI for two years after being found guilty of bullying, threatening and intimidating wicketkeeper-batsman Wriddhiman Saha over an interview request. Boria won't get accreditation as a member of press for any cricket matches in India for two years and he won't be allowed to interview any registered cricketer during the time period.

318.title: H'yana BJP plans outreach programme to celebrate 8 yrs of Modi govt
318.article_body: BJP's Haryana unit will launch an outreach programme on Thursday to mark the completion of eight years of PM Narendra Modi's government. BJP spokesperson Sudesh Kataria said that party leaders will take the welfare policies of the Modi government and the state government to the public during the programme. The programme intends to cover 21 lakh families in 21 days.

319.title: OnePlus 10R 5G with HyperBoost Gaming Engine available on open sale now
319.article_body: OnePlus announced that the open sale for its flagship OnePlus 10R 5G smartphone has begun today. The smartphone aims to deliver an improved gaming experience and features like 6.7" 120Hz FHD+ Fluid AMOLED display, MediaTek Dimensity 8100-MAX chipset & HyperBoost Gaming Engine. It offers two SUPERVOOC charging options, 150W and 80W, in Sierra Black & Forest Green editions.

320.title: Disgusting: Lili calls out Kim over losing weight to fit into her Met Gala dress
320.article_body: Actress Lili Reinhart seemingly called out Kim Kardashian after she admitted she went on an extreme diet in order to fit into Marilyn Monroe's dress for her Met Gala 2022 look. Taking to social media, Lili wrote, "To walk on...red carpet...where you say how starving you are...because you haven't eaten carbs...to fit in a f***ing dress...The ignorance is other-worldly disgusting."

321.title: Underground Chhatarpur metro station to link Yellow, Silver lines: Official
321.article_body: Chhatarpur station on Delhi Metro's Yellow Line will soon get an underground interchange station to connect it with the upcoming Silver Line (Tughlakabad to Aerocity), said DMRC Principal Executive Director (Corporate Communications) Anuj Dayal. The interchange facility will be provided via the existing station's gate number two. Construction of the Silver Line corridor has commenced, DMRC said.

322.title: Clashes in Rajasthan result of appeased culture of Cong govt: Vasundhara Raje
322.article_body: Former Rajasthan Chief Minister and Bharatiya Janata Party leader Vasundhara Raje on Tuesday slammed the Congress-led state government for the communal unrest in the state. "After Karauli and Alwar, the incident of communal tension has now come to the fore in Chief Minister's home town, Jodhpur. Such incidents are result of the appeased culture of Congress-led Rajasthan government," she said.

323.title: Bombay HC grants anticipatory bail to BJP MLA Ganesh Naik in rape case
323.article_body: Bombay High Court on Wednesday granted anticipatory bail to BJP Airoli MLA Ganesh Naik in a rape case. Naik was booked by the Navi Mumbai Police for allegedly threatening and raping a female friend. The woman had claimed that she had been in a live-in relationship with Naik for over 27 years and he is her son's biological father.

324.title: Sensex crashes over 1,300 points to end at 55,669 after repo rate hiked to 4.40%
324.article_body: The stock benchmarks fell the most in over eight weeks on Wednesday after the RBI announced a 40 bps hike in repo rate to 4.40%. While the Sensex tanked 1,306 points to close at 55,669, the Nifty 50 tanked 392 points to close at 16,678. Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank, HDFC and Bajaj Finance were among the top index losers.

325.title: Judge denies Heard's request to dismiss Depp's defamation lawsuit
325.article_body: Amber Heard's request to dismiss actor Johnny Depp's defamation lawsuit mid-trial has been denied by Judge Penney Azcarate.  "The court should grant the motion to strike because the undisputed evidence is...Depp did...abuse Amber," said Heard's attorney. However, the judge denied the request and said enough evidence had been presented in the ongoing trial, adding the jury will give the verdict.

326.title: I've to keep forgetting he's my brother: Selvaraghavan on working with Dhanush
326.article_body: Speaking about actor Dhanush, the actor's brother and director Selvaraghavan said, "To handle such an actor, I have to keep forgetting he is my brother. I have to keep [reminding] myself...that he has achieved a lot." "During one or two films...I had a lot of things to tell him, then he was all on his own," added Selvaraghavan.

327.title: TMC appoints ex-Lok Sabha MP Kirti Azad as its new Goa unit chief
327.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Wednesday appointed cricketer-turned-politician Kirti Azad as its new party incharge in Goa. Azad, who previously served as a Lok Sabha MP from Bihar, had switched over to TMC from Congress in 2021. Notably, his appointment comes days after Kiran Kandolkar tendered his resignation as TMC's Goa unit chief, stating that party has 'no future in state'.

328.title: Suffered loss of ₹90,000: Delhi juice shop owner as his shop demolished
328.article_body: A juice shop owner in Delhi's Tughlaqabad, where the civic body demolished illegal construction, said his family has suffered a loss of ₹90,000. "My father and I have been running the shop for more than 23 years. I was crying and showed them the registration papers. They didn't stop," Mohammed Ashraf said. He further said, "Everything is gone now."

329.title: To see Gangubai Kathiawadi trend globally is overwhelming: Alia Bhatt
329.article_body: Speaking about the success of her film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', actress Alia Bhatt said, "With all the love that 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has been receiving from its viewers all over the world, I'm rendered speechless." Alia added that she's overwhelmed to see 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' trend globally. "Our rich variety of Indian films continues to captivate people around the world," she said.

330.title: I've had worst experience with Swiggy, RIP customer care: Cricketer Gowtham
330.article_body: Cricketer Krishnappa Gowtham, who made his ODI debut in 2021 against Sri Lanka, took to Twitter on Tuesday night to complain about Swiggy. "I've had the absolute worst experience with Swiggy", Gowtham tweeted, adding that he didn't receive order placed at 9:45 pm. "At 11:35 pm...I got a response from customer support saying...there's nothing they can do #RIPCUSTOMERCARE," Gowtham said.

331.title: Akhil Gogoi demands govt to implement Article 370-like provision in Assam
331.article_body: Activist and Sivasagar MLA Akhil Gogoi on Wednesday demanded that the Centre should implement Article 370-like provision in Assam for the "Constitutional safeguard" of the indigenous people of the state. "The indigenous people of the state will not be safe until Article 370 or 371 (A) like safeguards are implemented," Gogoi said.

332.title: 76% prisoners are undertrials; ratio highest in Delhi, J&K: NCRB data
332.article_body: About 76% of all prison inmates in India were undertrials, of which about 68% were either illiterate or school dropouts, as per  National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) data for 2020. Among the undertrials, about 20% were Muslims, while about 73% were Dalits, tribals or OBCs. Delhi and J&K have highest ratio of undertrials in jails at 91%, the data showed.

333.title: Can't believe I'm such a lucky girl: Esha on completing 10 yrs in B'wood
333.article_body: Actress Esha Gupta completed ten years in Bollywood. Speaking about it, she said, "It's surreal and still feels unreal. Sometimes, I still cannot believe...I'm such a lucky girl to be an actor in the Indian film industry." "A girl from nowhere, making it to the big screen and people knowing my name! I cannot be more grateful," she added.

334.title: BJP high command instructed party to defame our govt: Rajasthan CM
334.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said that BJP high command instructed the party to "defame" the state government and create instability. "They (BJP) bulldoze the poor people's houses," Gehlot added. "Those who've become CM candidate...There is a competition (among them) and they have been given homework, which is why they are stretching everything," Gehlot stated.

335.title: India asking Russia to discount its oil to less than $70 per barrel: Report
335.article_body: India is trying to convince Russia for deeper discounts on its oil to less than $70/barrel in order to compensate for the risk of dealing with the OPEC producer, Bloomberg reported. Global benchmark Brent is currently trading near $105/barrel. India's private and state refiners have reportedly bought over 40 million barrels of Russian crude since its invasion of Ukraine.

336.title: We've just missed out when we are chasing big totals: David Warner
336.article_body: Talking about their performance in the ongoing IPL season, DC opener David Warner said they have managed to get "close" to winning most of their games but have missed out while "chasing big totals". He added, "There's strong competition...We could get that upper hand if we beat SRH." DC, who are seventh on IPL standings, will face SRH on Thursday.

337.title: Twitter tests 'Circle' feature to share tweets with up to 150 people
337.article_body: Twitter has started testing a new feature called 'Twitter Circle' that will let users send Tweets to select people, the company announced on Tuesday.  A user can include up to 150 people in their Twitter Circle and only those individuals can interact with the Tweets shared in that Circle. Currently, the feature's available to a limited number of people globally.

338.title: Pune civic body to clean manholes with robotic machines to avoid deaths
338.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to start cleaning manholes with the help of robotic machines to avoid deaths during the cleaning. Pune Smart City Development Corporation Limited bought three robotic manhole cleaning machines and handed them over to Pune civic body. The PMC already has jetting and other machines to clean manholes but these machines require more space.

339.title: India committed to meeting needs of poor, vulnerable through infra: PM
339.article_body: India remains committed to meeting the needs of the poorest and the most vulnerable by building the next generation infrastructure to realise their aspirations, PM Narendra Modi said on Wednesday. He was addressing the inaugural session of the International Conference on Disaster Resilient Infrastructure (ICDRI). "People must be at the heart of any infrastructure growth story," PM added.

340.title: Situation under control in Jodhpur: Police Commissioner Navajyoti Gogoi
340.article_body: Jodhpur Police Commissioner Navajyoti Gogoi, on Wednesday, said the situation in the city, where communal clashes broke out recently, is under control. "Right now, the situation is under control as no such incident (violence) has erupted in the city since yesterday noon," he said. Adequate police forces have been deployed and senior officials are monitoring the situation firsthand, he added.

341.title: Pune's SPPU rejuvenates British-era pond for rainwater accumulation
341.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has rejuvenated a British-era pond on its premises in a joint effort with Karve Institute of Social Service for rainwater accumulation purposes. The previously defunct pond, named 'Hatti Haud', has been rebuilt and will be operational from June onwards. "The rainwater [stored]...will reduce SPPU’s dependency on municipal water supply," an official said.

342.title: RBI hikes cash reserve ratio by 50 bps to 4.5% from May 21 onwards
342.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday said the monetary policy committee has decided to hike the cash reserve ratio (CRR) by 50 bps to 4.5% from May 21. Withdrawal of liquidity due to the hike could be to the order of ₹87,000 crore. Average surplus liquidity in the banking system was at over ₹7 lakh crore in April, Das said.

343.title: SC denies bail to Dawood Ibrahim's nephew in 2019 extortion case
343.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday denied bail to fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim's nephew in a 2019 extortion case for alleged threats issued to a builder. "We see no reason to allow the applicant on bail at this stage...investigation is complete and the charge-sheet is filed. We direct the court to frame the charges against the accused within six months," SC said.

344.title: Nepal airport terminal evacuated over 'suspicious object' phone call
344.article_body: Passengers and staff members were on Wednesday evacuated from the domestic terminal of  Tribhuvan International Airport in Nepal after authorities received a phone call claiming that a suspicious object had been planted inside the terminal. A search is underway for the suspicious object. Authorities are also working to determine the source of the phone call.

345.title: MNS General Secy performs 'Maha Aarti' in Pune's Hanuman temple, detained
345.article_body: The Pune Police on Wednesday detained MNS General Secretary Ajay Shinde and six others after they performed 'Maha Aarti' in Khalkar Hanuman Temple. "They were detained as per preventive action," Pune Police officials said. Over 250 Maharashtra Navnirman Sena workers have been detained for playing Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers, Maharashtra Police said.

346.title: Naxalite, wanted in over 40 cases, killed during gunfight in Jharkhand
346.article_body: A Naxalite, wanted in over 40 cases, was killed during a gunfight with security forces in Jharkhand's Khunti district. The deceased, Laka Pahan, was the sub-zonal commander of People's Liberation Front of India (PLFI). On Wednesday morning, a group of Naxals led by Pahan opened fire on security personnel, who retaliated in self-defence, thus killing Pahan, an official said.

347.title: Destroyed phone, tore my clothes: Kerala man who renounced Islam
347.article_body: A 24-year-old Kerala man, who had renounced Islam, was allegedly attacked by a group of people before addressing an event in Kollam. He was set to speak about his experience as a student of Islamic studies. "I was manhandled. They destroyed my mobile phone and tore my clothes…When locals raised an alarm, the police saved me," he said.

348.title: Amazon doubles export target from India to $20 billion by 2025
