348.article_body: Amazon on Wednesday promised to export locally produced Indian goods worth $20 billion by 2025, doubling its $10 billion-goal set in 2020 for the same time frame. The company's 'Global Selling' programme has attracted over 1,00,000 exporters since its launch in 2015 in India, it added. In 2021, over 1,000 Indian exporters on the programme crossed ₹1 crore in sales.

349.title: Metro work on B'luru's Silk Board-KR Puram line likely to be delayed
349.article_body: Metro work on Bengaluru's Silk Board-KR Puram metro line is likely to be delayed, according to a report. Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation officials have said the delay is caused due to the shifting of gas pipelines at Kadubeesanahalli and KR Puram. "GAIL has assured us of completing the work at the earliest," BMRCL MD Anjum Parwez was quoted as saying.

350.title: Protesters block roads in Armenian capital to call for PM's resignation
350.article_body: Protesters on Wednesday blocked major roads in the Armenian capital Yerevan demanding the resignation of Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. Protesters also called for citizens to commit acts of civil disobedience. Pashinyan has faced criticism since he agreed to a Russian-brokered ceasefire to end six weeks of war with Azerbaijan over the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh in November 2020.

351.title: 16-year-old Kailia Posey, grinning girl in popular GIF, dies by suicide
351.article_body: Kailia Posey, who became famous after appearing in TLC's 'Toddlers & Tiaras', has died aged 16. "Unfortunately in one impetuous moment, she made the rash decision to end her earthly life," her family told TMZ. A scene from one of the episodes, in which she grins, became one of the most popular GIFs on the internet.

352.title: Gavaskar returns 20,000 sq ft unused plot given to him 33 years ago by Maha govt
352.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has returned a government plot allotted to him in Mumbai 33 years ago, an official from the Maharashtra housing agency MHADA said. Gavaskar informed the state government he couldn't set up a cricket academy at the 20,000 sq ft plot in Bandra as proposed. The MHADA had requested Gavaskar to return the unused plot last year.

353.title: Mukhtar Ansari's lawyer, son booked for misbehaving with official
353.article_body: Jailed mafia-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari's lawyer Daroga Singh and his son Abbas Ansari have been booked by UP Police for allegedly misbehaving with a revenue worker. The incident occurred during the metering and demarcation of land owned by Singh. The Mau administration said that the land illegally acquired by Singh will be demarcated amid heavy security arrangements.

354.title: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to 55,846 after RBI hikes repo rate to 4.40%
354.article_body: Sensex tanked over 1,000 points and was trading at 55,846 on Wednesday after the RBI announced a hike in the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40%. The Nifty 50 was also down over 330 points and was trading at around 16,736. "We must remain in readiness to use policy tools to preserve macro stability," RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said.

355.title: Man creates ruckus at Chennai de-addiction centre, beaten to death; 7 held
355.article_body: Police have arrested seven people in connection with the death of a 48-year-old man, M Raj, who was admitted to a de-addiction centre in Chennai. Police found out that the man had created a ruckus at the centre, following which, the workers beat him with sticks and other things. Reports said that Raj's family found bruise marks on his body.

356.title: He is IPL legend: Irfan Pathan on Dhawan's 62*(53) vs GT
356.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan called PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan "an IPL legend" after he remained unbeaten at 62 to help them win against GT. "The 15th season is going on and there have only been two seasons where he hasn't scored 300 runs," added Pathan. So far, Dhawan has scored 369 runs in 10 games in IPL 2022.

357.title: MBBS students in Maha told to finish internships in hospitals of own colleges
357.article_body: The Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS) has asked medical students in the state to compulsorily complete their internships at the hospitals attached to their own institutes. A circular regarding the same was issued on Monday. Earlier, students were allowed to finish internships at hospitals attached to medical colleges other than the ones they had enrolled in for MBBS.

358.title: Film's politics is important, it zeroes down to what's your intention: Kabir
358.article_body: Filmmaker Kabir Khan said he is worried when people in industry say they are apolitical. "The way we frame a character is telling our politics...The politics of a film is very important, as it zeroes down to what is your intention and what do you want to show ultimately," he said, adding one cannot be apolitical as a human being.

359.title: J&K LG lays foundation stone for Amarnath Shrine Board Office in Srinagar
359.article_body: Manoj Sinha, the Lieutenant Governor of Jammu and Kashmir, laid the foundation stone of the Amarnath Shrine Board Office in Srinagar on Tuesday. Earlier on Monday, Nitishwar Kumar, Principal Secretary to the LG had also taken tour of the proposed sites for halt stations like Baltal Base Camp, Domail access point, etc. to ensure smooth conduct of the Amarnath Yatra.

360.title: RBI increases repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40% with immediate effect
360.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday announced that the monetary policy committee has unanimously decided to increase the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40% with immediate effect. Das said that the decision was made after reassessing the inflation growth dynamics and macroeconomic situation. Consequently, the standing deposit facility rate stands adjusted to 4.15%.

361.title: They have the upper hand over RCB: Imran Tahir on 9th placed CSK
361.article_body: Ex-CSK spinner Imran Tahir said CSK who are currently ninth on the IPL 2022 points table, have the upper hand over RCB in their upcoming IPL 2022 match. "RCB will be low on confidence having lost three games," added Tahir. "The match will be very important for CSK," stated Tahir. RCB are currently sixth on the points table.

362.title: 3 labourers die in ammonia tank blast in Goa's Vasco
362.article_body: At least three labourers were killed on the spot after a blast in an ammonia tank at the Zuari Agro Chemicals Limited (ZACL) plant in Goa's Vasco. "The state machinery has immediately responded and is making every effort to bring normalcy to the situation," Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant tweeted. Sawant also assured that there was no gas leakage.

363.title: Brown & beautiful: Samantha on Bridgerton star Simone Ashley's Met Gala look
363.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared a video of 'Bridgerton' season 2 actress, Simone Ashley, from her appearance at the Met Gala 2022 held on Monday. Sharing the video on her Instagram Stories, Samantha wrote, "Brown and beautiful. #SimoneAshley #Bridgerton." The video showed Simone, who played Kate Sharma on 'Bridgerton 2', posing as she arrived on the red carpet.

364.title: MNS workers detained outside Raj Thackeray’s Mumbai home, 9 in Pune
364.article_body: Mumbai Police detained several Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers gathered outside party chief Raj Thackeray's residence, officials said. At least nine MNS workers were also detained when they came out of a temple after performing 'aarti' in Pune, officials added. Notably, Thackeray had asked people to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques from May 4 if loudspeakers there were not removed.

365.title: COVID-19 situation not so serious at present: Delhi Health Minister
365.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Wednesday said the COVID-19 situation in the national capital is not so serious at present. "We have reserved 10,000 beds in hospitals for COVID-19 cases, but less than 200 of those are occupied," Jain added. His remarks came a day after Delhi reported 1,414 new COVID-19 cases and one related death.

366.title: EU to ban 3 Russian state-owned broadcasters amid Ukraine war
366.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen said the European Union will ban three Russian state-owned broadcasters as part of a sixth sanctions package over Ukraine war.  "They will not be allowed to distribute their content anymore...in whatever shape or form," she added. She called the channels "mouthpieces that amplify [Russian President Vladimir] Putin's lies and propaganda aggressively".

367.title: My tweets get more replies than Modiji's tweets: Ola CEO on 'troll attacks'
367.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal tweeted, "Ola Electric & I are subject to one of the biggest troll attacks in corporate India." He added, "My tweets now get more replies than even Modiji's tweets despite a fraction of his followers." On Wednesday, a Livemint report claimed that dubious Twitter accounts are defending Ola Electric amid the criticism of the company.

368.title: 13-year-old girl raped by policeman when she went to file rape case in UP
368.article_body: A 13-year-old rape survivor in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur was allegedly raped again by the station house officer (SHO) when she went to the police station to file a complaint against four men for kidnapping and gangraping her. The police have lodged a case against six people, including the SHO and her aunt. The aunt and two men have been arrested.

369.title: Actress Amy Jackson dating British actor Ed Westwick: Reports
369.article_body: Actress Amy Jackson is reportedly dating British actor Ed Westwick, who's known for his role as 'Chuck Bass' in 'Gossip Girl'. Pictures have surfaced online where Amy was spotted while taking a walk with Ed in London. Amy and Ed met each other for the first time at Saudi Arabia's Red Sea International Film Festival last December, reports added.

370.title: I am not Rahul, I won't run from Amethi: Irani on contesting from Wayanad
370.article_body: Answering a question on whether she would consider contesting elections from Wayanad if BJP asked her to, Union Minister Smriti Irani said, "I am not Rahul Gandhi, I don't run from Amethi." She said this during her visit to Rahul Gandhi's Lok Sabha constituency Wayanad, where she went to review developmental projects. In 2019, Irani defeated Rahul in Amethi.

371.title: Shigella identified as cause of food poisoning in Kerala girl who died
371.article_body: The Kerala Health Department has identified Shigella bacteria as cause of food poisoning in the 16-year-old girl who died after eating shawarma from local eatery. Thirty other people were also hospitalised after eating from the eatery. The District medical officer Dr S K Ramdas said presence of shigella was confirmed after testing the blood and faeces of the patients.

372.title: ICC release team rankings for all formats after annual update
372.article_body: The ICC today released team rankings after the annual update. Australia increased their lead over second-placed India from one to nine rating points in Test rankings. In ODI rankings, New Zealand remain on top, but their lead over England is reduced to one rating point. India remain on top in T20Is, extending their lead over second-placed England to five points.

373.title: Neighbours clash over trivial issues in Delhi's Shahbad; FIRs filed
373.article_body: Delhi Police filed cross FIRs against two neighbours, Kamalkant and Azad, for allegedly fighting over trivial issues and assaulting each other near Peer Baba Mazar in Delhi's Shahbad Dairy area on Tuesday. According to police, first, Azad and his friends attacked Kamalkant and his family at his residence, following which Kamalkant and his friends attacked Azad and his family members.

374.title: Defeat against PBKS bitter pill to swallow: GT's David Miller
374.article_body: GT batter David Miller said their defeat against PBKS on Tuesday was quite a "bitter pill to swallow". He, however, also added, "It's going to happen through the campaign...with so many games. So, hopefully, we got the bad game out the way." Miller, who has scored 287 runs in 10 games this season, got out for 11 runs against PBKS.

375.title: I feel sorry for Ravindra Jadeja but CSK are on the backfoot: Brad Hogg
375.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja who recently stepped down as CSK captain, ex-KKR spinner Brad Hogg said, "I feel sorry for Jadeja. Jadeja...didn't have the full quota of players. So that's put extra pressure." "But at the end of the day, CSK are on the backfoot. They have made the move," added Hogg. MS Dhoni replaced Jadeja as CSK captain.

376.title: Police release photos of man accused in acid attack in Bengaluru
376.article_body: Kamakshipalya Police have released pictures of the acid attack accused, Nagesh Babu, in different looks and sought help from public to arrest him. Babu has been absconding since last Thursday after he allegedly threw acid on a 24-year-old woman in Bengaluru's Sunkadakatte after she rejected his marriage proposal. Police have formed seven teams comprising over 100 policemen to arrest him.

377.title: There's peace in Maharashtra, no protest being held: Sanjay Raut
377.article_body: There is peace in Maharashtra and no protest is being held in the state, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said on Wednesday. "No illegal loudspeakers running in the state...Bal Thackeray and Veer Savarkar are the ones who taught Hindutva to the country." Raut added. "Shiv Sena's school of Hindutva is original," Raut stated.

378.title: Couple booked days after burnt body of 33-yr-old man found in Punjab
378.article_body: Seven days after the burnt body of a 33-year-old man was found in Punjab’s Lalru, police booked a couple in connection with the case. Police recovered the body from a secluded place on April 26. On that day, the deceased man’s brother was told by the accused that they dropped the victim off in Zirakpur.

379.title: Russia learning from early mistakes in Ukraine war, will improve: US
379.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said that Russia is learning from its mistakes in the early stages of the Ukraine war and will improve their logistical efforts. "We saw them make some bad assumptions at the beginning…We saw them fail to integrate aerial fires with their ground maneuver…We'll see them improve their massing of fires," Austin told the US Congress.

380.title: Astrologers, priests in Telangana decide not to fix muhurta for C-section
380.article_body: Astrologers and priests in Telangana's Karimnagar have joined hands to support the government's initiative to promote normal deliveries and not fix muhurta for the delivery of babies through Caesarean section (C-section). "It has become a practice for people to...fix auspicious time..for deliveries. C-section is advisable only when normal delivery becomes complicated," the District Collector said.

381.title: Akshay Kumar completes 30 years in B'wood; Prithviraj makers unveil poster
381.article_body: Akshay Kumar recently completed 30 years in the Hindi film industry and Yash Raj Films celebrated the actor's special milestone by creating a new 'Prithviraj' poster that features every film that he has been a part of. In the video, Akshay is seen saying, "It didn't...cross my mind that this activity is happening to celebrate my 30 years in cinema!"

382.title: ITBP personnel perform Yoga at height of 17,000 ft in Sikkim Himalayas
382.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel participated in a Yoga session on Wednesday at an altitude of 17,000 feet amid snow conditions in Sikkim Himalayas, ahead of the International Day of Yoga 2022. A group of around 20 personnel of ITBP were seen performing at least three different Yoga asanas (postures).

383.title: Mother, son die as car collides with tractor in Greater Noida
383.article_body: A 70-year-old woman and her 35-year-old son died as their car collided with a tractor that allegedly came on the wrong lane of an expressway in UP's Greater Noida, police said. The victims were returning to Haryana after purchasing medicines from Meerut, police added. The tractor took a sudden turn and the car crashed into its front portion, police stated.

384.title: Queen of Denmark Margrethe II hosts dinner for PM Modi at Amalienborg Palace
384.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was accorded a warm welcome by the Queen of the Kingdom of Denmark, Margrethe II at Amalienborg Palace in Copenhagen on the second day of his Europe visit. PM Modi also attended a private dinner hosted by the Queen. He felicitated Her Majesty on the occasion of the Golden Jubilee of her reign, the MEA stated.

385.title: Ukraine will win the war: UK PM Boris Johnson
385.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Tuesday said that Ukraine will win the war against Russia. "I have one message for you today - Ukraine will win, Ukraine will be free," said Johnson in a virtual address to the Ukrainian Parliament. "This is Ukraine's finest hour, that will be remembered and recounted for generations to come," he added.

386.title: Shatrughan Sinha and family performed black magic on me, ran 'sex scam': Pooja Mishra
386.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 5' contestant Pooja Mishra, in a recent interview, claimed that veteran actor Shatrughan Sinha and his family performed magic on her. She also claimed that they used to make her unconscious and trade her in a 'sex scam'. She further alleged that they blocked 35 films of her from releasing.

387.title: Ranveer Singh's 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' to release with 0 cuts: Report
387.article_body: Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' has reportedly received a U/A certificate from the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC). "Ranveer is seen threatening to castrate himself in a scene," said a source as quoted by the report. "They gave a clean U/A to the film without asking for any sort of cut," added the source.

388.title: Arshdeep has got a lot of nerve, he has shown that in death overs: Rabada
388.article_body: PBKS pacer Kagiso Rabada has praised his teammate Arshdeep Singh, stating that the 23-year-old has got a lot of "nerve" and he's showing that while bowling in the death overs. "Arshdeep reads the game well, he's able to execute his skill and he's done it game in game out," added Rabada. Arshdeep has picked four wickets in 10 games.

389.title: Delhi Police to take action against its personnel who were absent on Eid
389.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday said departmental action would be taken against its personnel of the 'Third Battalion' who were absent on Eid. About 500 personnel of the battalion were deployed across the city on the occasion of Eid, an official said. Notably, tight security arrangements were put in place at major religious places for peaceful progression of namaz.

390.title: Married Australia-returnee among 2 held for stalking Mohali girl
390.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly stalking a girl outside Chandigarh’s MCM DAV College in Sector 36. One of the accused recently returned from Australia and started working with an advocate in Mohali, police said. He also recently got married. The victim, a Mohali resident, said that the incident occurred while she was waiting for her father outside the college.

391.title: Father booked for 5-yr-old son's death in bike accident in Panvel
391.article_body: A 36-year-old man has been booked after his five-year-old son died in a bike accident in Panvel near Mumbai. The man was riding the bike while his wife and older son were riding pillion. The deceased child was sitting on the petrol tank when the bike collided with a wall and fell outside a bridge, causing injuries to all.

392.title: Hoped Telugu version wouldn't release, dubbing wasn't good: Director on 'Raja..'
392.article_body: Dharmesh Darshan, director of 'Raja Hindustani', said that he hoped that the producers wouldn't release the film's Telugu version. "The dubbing quality was not good...If a better quality of dubbing was done, it would have become a hit even in the Telugu version...When it failed, everybody agreed that the director was correct," he added.

393.title: Heavy rains lash parts of Hyderabad, waterlogging in many areas
393.article_body: Heavy rains lashed parts of Hyderabad on Wednesday morning causing waterlogging in many areas. Seethafalmandi near Secunderabad received 72.8 mm rainfall, the highest as of 6 am, as per official data. DRF teams have been deployed to clear water stagnations and treefalls, and provide assistance to citizens. Thundershowers are likely to occur in parts of Telangana, IMD said.

394.title: 24-year-old man arrested for raping cousin's wife in Pune
394.article_body: A 24-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping his cousin's wife at her house in Pune. The accused had allegedly barged into the 26-year-old woman's house at around 2 am on April 30 and raped her after threatening to tell her husband about their Instagram chats. The accused was arrested after the victim lodged an FIR on Tuesday.

395.title: North Korea fires unidentified projectile into sea, 14th launch this year
395.article_body: North Korea fired an unidentified projectile toward the sea off its east coast on Wednesday, South Korea's military said. Japan's Coast Guard said it could be a ballistic missile. The launch, which marks North Korea's 14th weapons test this year, comes days after North Korean leader Kim Jong-un vowed to bolster his nuclear arsenal "at the fastest possible pace".

396.title: Raj Thackeray shares Bal Thackeray's video amid Hanuman Chalisa row
396.article_body: Amid the Azaan-Hanuman Chalisa row, MNS chief Raj Thackeray tweeted Bal Thackeray's video in which the latter is heard saying that if our government comes to power then we will stop namaz on roads and remove loudspeakers from masjids. Raj Thackeray had appealed to Hindus to play Hanuman Chalisa in places where they hear Azaan being done on loudspeakers today.

397.title: Maha MP Navneet Rana, husband Ravi Rana get bail in Hanuman Chalisa case
397.article_body: Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana, who were arrested in connection with the Hanuman Chalisa row, have been granted bail by a Mumbai court. They were arrested on April 23 after they announced to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside CM Uddhav Thackeray's private residence 'Matoshree'. A court had sent the couple to judicial custody till May 6.

398.title: There's need for security agencies to have quick access to info: Shah
398.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said there is a need for legal and security agencies to have automated, secure and immediate access to information obtained from reliable sources. "Security requirements today have changed significantly as compared to the earlier security challenges in terms of data, scope and complexity," Shah added.

399.title: Nothing left, haven't eaten in 3 days: Vendor on Banjara Market demolition
399.article_body: Sushila, one of the vendors in Gurugram's Banjara Market, where demolition drive was undertaken recently, said that they have nothing left and that they haven't eaten or taken bath in three days. Another vendor, Chini, said that she was cooking when the machine demolished her house. "They've made us homeless...there has been loss of lakhs and crores," another vendor said.

400.title: BSF personnel injured in accidental firing from his own rifle in Bhuj
400.article_body: A Border Security Force (BSF) personnel was injured after an accidental firing from his own rifle due to rough weather in the sea near Gujarat's Bhuj. "While depositing the weapon...due to extremely high turbulence...Constable Pratap fell down on...the Floating Border Out-Post and accidentally one round got fired from his service rifle piercing the right side of his abdomen," BSF said.

401.title: It’s his woman, those are Kanye’s kids: Hughley on Pete's new tattoo
401.article_body: Discussing the new tattoo of Kim Kardashian's boyfriend Pete Davidson, actor DL Hughley said, "It's his woman, those are Kanye West's kids. If you tattooed my kids on your neck, I would have something to say about it." "That would piss me off," added Hughley. "If you...got my kids tattooed...look, they will always be mine," stated Hughley.

402.title: Another Durgapur-bound SpiceJet flight faces technical issue, returns to Chennai
402.article_body: A Durgapur-bound SpiceJet flight had to return to Chennai after take-off last night due to a technical issue, a SpiceJet spokesperson told the Hindustan Times. The flight reportedly took off after a delay of 6.5 hours. The incident comes after another SpiceJet flight to Durgapur from Mumbai was hit by severe turbulence on Sunday in which 40 people were injured.

403.title: 'Koffee with Karan' will not be returning, announces Karan Johar
403.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar today announced his talk show 'Koffee with Karan' will not be returning.   "Koffee with Karan has been a part of my life, and yours, for 6 seasons now. I'd like to think we've made an impact and even found our place in pop culture history," Johar said. The last season of the show ended in March 2019.

404.title: When I didn't do well, Deepak Chahar called me, gave me tips: Mukesh
404.article_body: CSK pacer Mukesh Choudhary has revealed that their ₹14-crore buy Deepak Chahar, who was ruled out of IPL 2022 due to injury concerns, has been in touch with him and has been guiding him in the ongoing IPL season. "In the initial matches of the tournament, I did not do well. Deepak Bhai called and gave me tips," added Choudhary.

405.title: 24-year-old woman raped, stabbed by 2 men in Gurugram; 1 arrested
405.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was allegedly raped and stabbed by two men in Gurugram's DLF Phase-3 area, police said on Tuesday. "On Monday, I got a desperate call from my wife...When I reached home, she told me she was raped by two [men]...one of them stabbed her," victim's husband said. Police have arrested one accused in connection with the case.
